description:
An enjoyable pizza spot during the middle of a day drinking Saturday. So to be fair, my review is slightly skewed because I was slightly intoxicated haha BUT I really do think the pizza is good. They have a lot of topping options available for their by the slice pizza, and they warm everything up for you after you order/purchase. The pizza itself has dough on the thicker side so don't expect a New York slice, but I honestly love a thicker dough so I didn't mind at all. And if you've been drinking like me, you'll want the extra dough!! The amount of toppings on the supreme was...a lot. Pepperoni, sausage and tons of peppers and onions. I was impressed. There were so many toppings that they kept falling off. 1 slice was very filling.

It's a small place so don't expect to find a seat to eat during busy times, but there are a few spots if you can snag em. The line went quickly and the staff were nice.
author: Bri T.

description:
I liked the crust quite a bit. It was thick and chewy. Slices are reheated from full sized pies. I think that is why the toppings might be a bit bland. The green peppers came through nicely but everything else was kind of tasteless.  That includes the sausage. 
Unfortunately, I got heartburn before I even finished the slice. It lasted for hours. 
The place is tiny. Service from the only employee was great. 
Probably best for late night quick bites.
author: Thomas D.

description: Always loved loved loved their pizza. I don't get am opportunity to be in the city much but when I do and am I'm the Castro area.. I must have a slice (or two) of their pizza. So fluffy get crispy just the right amount.. they never disappoint. I wish they have a location in the South Bay..
author: Jane S.

description: Pizza perfect for those late nights , daytime or anytime really. Although since it's a community favorite at night the wait can be lengthy. Worth the wait though !
author: Natalie G.

description: Don't come here. Pizza is mediocre and when we asked for water, they said they don't have "water cups." Isn't that illegal? We saw the workers give people water in "water cups" 15 later. Again, don't come here.
author: Grace S.

description:
Wow, just probably the worst slice of pizza I've ever had. We ordered a 16" nizario special and what can I say...a Digiorno frozen pizza would have been 10x better. Mealy cheese that was probably frozen, mediocre ingredients, overly salty olives, just a really bad pizza. And just barely warm at that. Toppings falling off all over the place...just really terrible.

Can't believe living in SF I'd say this but you'd be better off with any chain delivery pizza (Pizza Hut, domino's, etc.) than this place. Ate it 3 hours ago and still feeling gross.
author: A S.

description: Not all pizza is created equal. All pizza is good. Some pizzas are great. Nizario's Pizza is extraordinary!!! I ordered the California special at 2:01 am, it arrived at 2:28 am and and it was amazing!!! How they made that magic come together that fast is beyond me! I will definitely be back in the near future!! The crust was so perfectly seasoned and delicious! I added garlic which I highly recommend! It was piping hot and cheesy delicious with a generous amount of toppings! Thank you for making my pizza fantasies come true!
author: Aleisha T.

description:
You can't go wrong with pizza! It was a friend's 30th birthday, so the bf and I flew in to celebrate for the weekend. First stop after we dropped off our bags at the airbnb was Nizario's.

A friend brought us here to get something in our bellies before a night of celebrating. It was our first time and we panicked as a line started to form behind us, so we just went with a classic. Pepperoni pizzas!

No pics to show since we had to eat fast to catch up with friends and also, the place is really small. You literally just grab, grub and go. There's a menu, but if you like to eat with your eyes, they have the pizzas ready to heat behind the glass. It takes less than 5 minutes to run through the oven and then you're set.

The slices are massive with plenty of cheese. The bf complained that it was greasy and didn't have enough pepperoni, but I didn't care. I just needed some carbs in preparation lol. For the price and its size, one slice was just enough to hold me through a night of drinking.
author: Jamie N.

description: Picked up a pretty satisfying slice of cheese pizza on a weeknight. They heat it up so its crispy how I like it. Friendly staff. They have ranch too, not the best ranch but, eh, what are you gonna do.
author: Shruti D.

description: Man. First off this place was amazing. Nice customer service. Very busy. But awesome pizza and service. I recommend to anyone who wants to try some amazing pizza. One of the best pizzerias I've been too
author: Henry P.

description: The pizza that I ordered was an extra large cheese type of pizza and I love how fluffy and fresh it was. I would personally recommend all who are pizza lovers to go there!!! Especially those of us that are queso lovers
author: Nichelle F.

description: Pizza was good the service was terrible. I paid for a ranch the cook not the cashier gave me 3 ranch accidentally this is my first time here so I didn't know how many packets they were supposed to give to me and I thought they were being nice, so I took it. The manager literally had the cook come to my table and ask for the ranch back. By  his time we had already opened 2. Idk about y'all but in all customer service jobs if they make a mistake or accidentally give you an extra plate that is their bad. Point being, it was just rude and even after the guy asked for the ranch back the manager kept on bringing up that they guy had given us extra ranch. It's a really small spot so I could hear him, my friend literally told him that if it was an issue we would pay the extra ranch. Anyways, worst experience ever, bitch omg over .75 ranch. TRASH
author: Nelly C.

description:
Nizario's is a pizza god for the the late night crowd. They breathe life into those stumbling out of the clubs and bars, many of whom know to leave at 1:45 just so they can snag a slice before closing time at 2am. 

Nizario's is not just for drunchy attacks though. They're also a fun late night date spot where you can grab a giant slice of pizza and hunker down in the car with a great view and that special someone. Over the years, my pizza slices have made their way to Twin Peaks, the Golden Gate Bridge, and Turtle Hill. Sometimes they don't make it that far though :) 

My go-to pizza is the California Special, which is a delicious combination of chicken, spinach, pesto, mozzarella, and feta cheese. The crust is on the thicker side with a nice chewy bite, but still has a slight crisp on the edge when it's fresh out of the oven. I'm not typically a crust eater, but I tend to polish off my slices here!

Nizario's is a small shop with very limited seating, so it's best to get your pizza to-go. Quick service and great pizza at an affordable price. Easily one of my favorite spots in the Castro!
author: Deanna Y.

description: Pizza was not good.I went all the way from daly city to castro to get this pizza since it had really good reviews.But when I eat it ,cheese didnt feel fresh.pesto was really oily.I had to order something else since i did not like this pizza.
author: Prerna M.

description:
WHY WE WENT HERE:
- every time I spend a night out in the Castro, we eat here

THE LOOK (FROM THE OUTSIDE):
- you're in the right place when you see that line overflowing outside

THE LOOK (FROM THE INSIDE):
- super cramped; very limited seating on the left, which can crowd the line that forms on the right to go straight toward the register which is somewhat in the center
- a bathroom is located WAY in the back

THE MENU:
- pizza
- drinks
- appetizers
- salads

WHAT WE ORDERED/THE TASTE:
- I honestly eat whatever my cousin or friends order me, and I'm not disappointed

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
- since I'm not the one who orders (or pays attention) I don't know how the customer service is other than right after our order is placed our pizza is always served fast and hot
author: Sarah-Lorraine L.

description: No matter how delicious the pizza. My concern is safety. The worker was there by himself and was in charge of both cashier and food line after midnight. He went back to the food line without changing his gloves after he touched the money bills. I can't believe he started topping the pizza with those dirty gloves.
author: Joe R.

description: Sadly, the pizza order wasn't met, we requested thin crust, crispy, the pizza was premade and merely warmed, the dough was warm, not hot, business located a block away, business missed it's mark to impress a neighbor to do a good job on an order. I don't recommend this business for pizza orders.
author: Edgar M.

description: The cashiers was giving me the changed ok. After that he was making pizza without washing his hands.
author: Jorge O.

description:
Great place to get a slice in the area.
Chicken Pesto - THE best pizza in the city
author: Ingrid A.

description: I really used to love this place.  The "Castro" was the best slice!  However, lately it seems quality is not the top priority.  My most recent slice was doughy and not fully cooked (I was told it would be 7 minutes until my slice was ready.....  I should have known better when only about 3 had passed).  The flavors are always on point, but it would be enhanced if the pizza was fully cooked.
author: Alisha G.

description: Came here for some lunch because I was craving pizza.. Ordered a slice of cheese. I didn't have to wait long for my slice of cheese to be ready. The pizza tasted great. I will definitely come back here if I am ever in the Castro and want a slice of pizza. I would recommend this place to any looking for a pizza place here in the city.
author: Isaac H.

description: One of the best pizza places I've been to in the city. Slices were big and thick and relatively cheap. I was reluctant to try the pepperoni pesto but it was very good! Will be coming back for sure!
author: Yesenia T.

description: This is good to go pizza. It's hot and fresh and in the neighborhood should you be walking around or hanging out.
author: Ashley P.

description: Ordered a simple pepperoni to a house party close by using the YelpEat24 app. The driver called as soon as he arrived,  greeted me with a smile,  confirmed he had put chili flake peppers in the box (I forgot to say so when I ordered). As i walked through the party, the pizza was intoxicating to all i passed by. My friend and I put down 2 slices and offered up some to a couple cool peeps we had met earlier.   We all agreed the flavor and texture was just as good as it smelled! (And we weren't just saying that, everyone asked where i ordered from...self promotion ;) Yum! Glad i can rely on Nazarios making sure i got my pizza and not the whole party, lol!
author: Janis R.

description: Worst Customer Service in the Castro.  Rude and blunt...want to feel like just another # off the street..come here.
author: Daniel P.

description: I specifically ordered a veg pizza with no mushrooms as I am allergic to it. When I called them to inform about the wrong order , the guy said "I can't do anything now" and HUNG UP the phone. very poor costumer service . The worst experience so far.
author: Sonam P.

description:
Order the Castro Special!

Enough said.

No but really the Castro Special is so delicious! It's a chicken, spinach, and feta cheese pizza. 

I came here after a night of drinking with my friends. The pizza was flavorful, fluffy, and perfect amount of crust. Best part was that it wasn't super greasy!
author: Shouka S.

description:
Went here with some friends to grab a bite to eat after a night out. We were pretty tanked to say the least, and this was a perfect respite on a cold, rainy night.

I decided to just go with the classic cheese pizza x2, which was a decent amount of food for the price. I was happy too that they were able to just slightly warm the pizza up without having it be scalding hot.

Overall, this place isn't the best pizza you've ever had, but it's a solid option in the Castro.
author: Ryan R.

description: I saw a cockroach scurrying around by the register last night. I mentioned it to the guy selling pizzas but he didn't seem to care. Like it wasn't a problem. This is a food establishment.
author: Mikhail R.

description: I used to love this place so much, now i feel like their workers just don't like working here anymore, before it was warm welcome and good costumer service but now when i enter, it was just whatever what you want kind of deal..... they also played loud middle eastern music..... oh well whatever
author: Rv Andrew V.

description: I first experienced the Castro special and man was I hooked! I make a point to stop by the point each time we visit the Castro- the price and flavor is something you can't beat.
author: Billy A.

description: I've been ordering from Nizarios for years and they are an excellent choice. The one time I had a problem, they followed up and addressed the issue promptly. It shows they care about their customers and want them to return.
author: Todd N.

description: Horrible customer service.  Ordered in person and was told 15min...came back 15min later and they were just putting in pizza.  They never put the cheesebread in and then after the pizza was done realized they needed to make cheesebread.  Never any acknowledgement of their dumbass mistake.  Good there is other comparable.options.  Idiots!
author: Wesley W.

description: Pizza was barely warm and soggy. This place used to be one of my favorites. They also used to be friendly, guy at counter was not at all. Another great place going bad : (
author: Ron J.

description: The pizza is usually good here, but yesterday when I ordered it for delivery it wasn't good at all. My nephew and I only had one slice each and threw the rest away.
author: Mickey M.

description:
I had the fortune of trying this little hole-in-the-wall this past weekend. Located right in the heart of the Castro, you can find a line here on many weekends and few parking options. Many patrons, I'm sure, will find other options along with busy corridor of San Francisco, but Nizario's is at least worth one's curiosity. 

Here, you have limited options for both meat and veggie lovers. For meat lovers you have your Hawaiian, pepperoni, and a few others. For veggie lovers, you have a cheese, mushroom, all-out veggie, and a pesto as well. The pizza's here are warmed up as you order, and ready-make from hours of prep to meet their peak periods. Please note their pizzas are pan-style, and not thin crust, or deep dish like your Dos Minos folks may push onto you. Here, you get what they have, and that's really it. What they have, however, is quite delicious and simple. 

I tried the pesto pizza, which was cooked to perfection. The crust was buttery enough, and the cheese wasn't melting off my plate. I was able to bite in with ease, and taste the subtle flavors of pesto as cheese oozed between my bite and the remaining slice. It was so satisfying, somehow, that I went back for another slice. 

If you're in the area, consider all the great options, but also consider Nizario's for their basic and cheap after hour eats.
author: Mohib Q.

description: This review is for my most recent visit to Nizario's. I usually get a slice of the garlic chicken pesto and it usually hits the spot. This last time, the dough didn't seem as crispy as it normally is and had less flavor than I'm used to. Still a great little pizza joint after a night of drinking (and I still ate it all).
author: Will H.

description: Pizza was okay. Ive had better. The place was packed, so maybe it was jyst me. The employee calling me "baby" was a bit creepy. Doubt I'll be back.
author: Lynette T.

description: NOT ALLERGY FREINDLY. Love this place when normal staff is working on weekends!! DO NOT GO on mondays and Tuesdays guy is an ahole!! I have allergies to peppers i asked him to make me a mushroom that wasnt next to bellpeppers and 2 DAYS in a row he said no!!
author: Maria A.

description: Ordered a salad through uber eats and they didn't put a fork in with my food and they gave me ranch when I asked for Italian dressing so now I have a salad I can't eat and I wasted $20 and an hour of my time. I'll be coming to the store tomorrow to ask for a refund. If they can't remember something as simple as a fork I can only imagine how much effort they put into preparing their food or keeping their establishment clean.
author: Marcus L.

description:
Typical grab and go pizza place. Slices are quite yummy and service obviously is super fast! Very easy and laid back casual atmosphere. The pepperoni pizza is delicious. The Hawaiian is also good. They also often have specials that are quite yummy. Overall solid spot!

Pros:
-Open super late! Perfect after a long night 
-Cheap (I mean it is a grab and go pizza place after all)
-Pizza is good!
author: Sami F.

description: I stumbled into this place at 1am after a long night of clubbing. Needless to say, sober or completely hammered, this place has awesome pizza. I cannot really recall what I had to eat, but it was good lol. Stay tuned for a sober experience addition to this review.
author: Terry P.

description: The pizza is served cold. I don't know if they switched owners or something but the pizza is served cold. I don't think I would go back. They put the pizza in the oven for 2 seconds. I think they think people don't care because the people who go there are usually drink but that is horrible customer service. Plus, the two idiots who are there late at night don't even aknowledge the customers.   Horrible customer service and cold pizza, in my opinion, is not good business practice. I wouldn't recommend this place anymore. HORRIBLE.
author: Jesus M.

description:
You grew up with Mario.
You played through the years and eventually met Wario.
In unfathomable recesses of the Castro awaits... Nizario.
He's gay. Are you surprised?
He's black. Yeah. You're surprised.
I made that up.

Went here years ago during a film festival and again during this past PRIDE Saturday. The PRIDE version had a security doorman controlling the flow of entry and notifying would-be eaters that it was cash-only.

$3-5ish per slice got us PEPPERONI, COMBO (standard meats & vegetables), and CASTRO SPECIAL (spinach, pesto, feta, chicken). I recommend 2 slices because 1 isn't enough.
author: Dan B.

description:
Food:
Slice - Yum! Vegetarian! I guess it's true what hey say, worth driving all the way from SJ ... Nomm... So good right to my liking 



Service:
Order at counter 


Atmosphere
Pretty small and very casual to go. It's conveniently in the middle of the commotion of a Friday night in the Mission
author: Angela L.

description: Blatantly stole my $5 yelp discount YELPEATS. Showed up to pick up my order and they told me before I could have my pizza I had to sign something saying my order total was $25.76 when really I paid $20.76 online. They 'tweaked' my order on Yelp as well and pretended they had no idea what happened.
author: Jamal B.

description:
Came here after a night out in the Castro. The line was out the door and everyone outside had a pizza in their hand. The place is pretty small and cramped, but they pumped through the line and we were able to order really quickly. As soon as I ordered, my pizza was plopped on a plate, I paid and as I turned around a group left a table and we were able to sit and enjoy the food. Talk about perfect timing as there's only about 4 tables inside the restaurant. 

The pizza itself was very good! For starters, its HUGE so I don't think you'd need two slices unless you're very hungry. I had the Castro special and it had chicken, spinach and feta cheese, I only wished I had a bigger appetite for a second slice since it was so good. 

If you're coming here at night, expect a long line and many, many drunk people. Prices were reasonable and it was the perfect thing after a night of drinking.
author: Cassandra C.

description:
3.5 stars but rounding down since they did NOT have sausage pizza available.. in the CASTRO!! However, the slice of Cheese Pizza ($3) I had was good- nice and cheesy, and still so hot it burned my mouth a bit despite giving it time to cool off. Service was also super quick. There are a few counter seats available inside, and plenty of sidewalk space to stand outside and eat as well. 

Overall, a good spot to go after drinking in the Castro, but they need to add a sausage option! Parking is difficult in this area, but street parking is available.
author: Amy D.

description:
I'll keep this short and sweet.
Went on a Wednesday night, they're open till 2am so that's a plus. Ordered a medium pesto pizza, came out to 15.20, not a bad of a price. Was cooked faster than expected and was delicious. 
Added some garlic and pepper and it was perfect. 
A very tasty pizza at a decent price. Definitely recommend going if you're in the mood for a new pizza spot.
author: John James M.

description:
The Castro slice is so good!  Chicken, feta, & pesto...yum!  The crust was pretty crispy.  

This location is kinda small...just a few tables and counter space.

Good for a quick bite.
author: Rose A.

description:
Pizza pizza pizza pizzzzaaa awwwwyeah.

Despite the fact that I had already eaten dinner that night, my friends convinced me to indulge in some pre-drinking foodies. I just can't say no to pizza. Especially not Nizarios.  Mmm pesto.  And they have more than just the typical cheese and red pepper shaker.  They have garlic!  Noms.  Perfect thing to avoid drankin on an empty stomach, and also conveniently within stumbling distance of the bars of the 'stro for when you're not in the mood for a dirty dog at the end of the night.
author: Cat C.

description:
Both times my slices were fresh from the oven. I waited a bit as he was preparing the new pizza but the wait was worth it and quicker than I anticipated. 

Pizzas by the slice is always great. Especially when you get the craving and the idea of ordering a whole pizza seems overwhelming because no one is there to share the pie with you. 

The pizza is thicker than Marcello's which is more of the floppier NY style but I liked Nizario's crustier slices. 

Stays opened LATE which is nice in a city where most everything closes up shop by 10-11pm.
author: Esther A.

description: They are open late, perfect for after a night of going out. I ordered a pepperoni pesto slice and I did not regret it.
author: Fernilla S.

description: I just had a mad Pizza craving after having some bottomless mimosas at Bisou.  Ran my trusty yelp app on my phone and Nizario's was the closest spot near me.  Pretty much a no frills by-the-slice pizza joint which was exactly what I needed. Ordered two mushroom slices (http://bit.ly/VjmaJR) and they definitely hit the spot.  Glad I found Nizario's and I would recommend coming by here for a quick pizza stop if you're roaming around the Castro.
author: Rodney H.

description: Got a slice, wasn't charged and asked how much to the slice. Told me $3.75 and walked away to continue with his business. Asked if I should pay and got ignored. Finished eating and went to leave, was then yelled at which is their way of saying it was time to pay. Take a look at your service sequence to avoid embarrassing customers. No need for this to happen.
author: Brian W.

description: Came here after Sunday funday and got the Castro special. It was delicious and I would defiantly come back. The best pizza spot in the Castro!
author: Vika N.

description: I've been coming here for years. The Castro Special is the best pizza I've ever had! So delicious! I've moved out of state and don't get to enjoy it as much, but I always make it a point to stop by after a night out in the Castro.
author: Joshua P.

description: Lame. Went in at 1:40am to grab a couple slices of pizza and they were already sold out for the night. I'm confused, you're open till 2am expecting plenty of people from the bars and you're already sold out. How is that possible? You could easily sell some basic cheese or pepperoni pizzas. And your best suggestion is to go to Marcello's, that's not acceptable. And the whole time you're standing there like McKayla Maroney with your hands wrapped under your arms like you don't care. I've never had this experience at Nizario's and it's disappointing.
author: Steven B.

description:
Not bad, and it's open way late which is great for the clubbers out in the neighborhood! The pizza was not bad, I had the Castro Special, definitely better with some alcohol on board. 

Not a ton of seating, but it's great that you can take a slice, stuff it in your face, and head back out!
author: Brian C.

description: The Greko pizza is so good... Got it delivered about 1am and it was still hot and amazingly good. A must try!
author: Kat K.

description:
Hungry after a night of dancing your butt off at The Cafe, Badlands or QBar? Need something to fill your stomach up after indulging in some booze and beverages at Last Call? 

If you answered yes to any or both of questions above, look no further! Nizario's Pizza parlor is thee spot to be! It's open til 2 in the morning to satisfy your hunger pains without any fuss...You just pay for the slice and stuff your face in the cheesy triangular piece of heaven.  The slices are huge and for about $3.50 - $4.00, you cannot go wrong here!

And it's only right because you're in the Castro to get "The Castro". It's absolutely delicious as it is is decked out with pesto, spinach, chicken and feta cheese. Peep the photo and if that doesn't leave you salivating, I don't know what's wrong!...ok maybe my photo skills, but without a doubt Nizario's serves some g double o d GOOD pizza.
author: May D.

description: Luke warm, limp, flavorless.   If you know anyone who likes this place, never speak to them again.
author: Brandyn B.

description: While visiting SF from LA, I was really craving some local pizza. Although the service was friendly and quick, the pizza was mostly flavorless. Probably best for soaking up alcohol, not savoring. 3 stars for the great location and service.
author: Shane G.

description: Best piZza you can get at 3 am the pesto is amazing and they are super fast ! I ordered from my uber ride a mile away from the house at 130 and the pizza was delivered with in thirty min !!!
author: Jill P.

description: Mikey U nailed it. Three stars by day, four stars by night. Maybe five. Sometimes, with a nice beer buzz, a slice of Nizario's is the best thing in the world.
author: Sean B.

description:
If you're looking for a pizza place that's open late, then Nizario's is definitely a perfect place to eat. They don't have much of a selection, so nothing fancy.

Pros:
1) Open Late
2) Large pieces
3) Fresh. Sometimes so fresh from the oven that you'll burn your mouth. Could barely taste anything the next day. I couldn't even eat anything hot or crispy.
4) AMAZING late night

Cons:
1) Limited selection
2) Can be salty.
3) Not quite the same experience during the day and sober.
author: James B.

description: It's just not good. The pizza tastes like reheated frozen cardboard. If Marcello's up the street is closed, go to 7-11 before this place.
author: Christopher W.

description:
I'm giving this 5 STARS because it has never, ever failed me. Doesn't matter if it's after a night of drinking or a night of work or even just one of those nights when you just need a slice of pizza, this takes the crown of best Castro pizza. 
CONSISTENTLY good crust, sauce, cheese, and toppings. My go to is the Super Combo and Castro but they are all bombskies. Service is quick and easy, they aren't storytellers, but they are nice people and they serve up killer pizza!! One of my absolute favorite by the slice joints in the whole city. No joke!
author: Luis B.

description: Dry bread with no sauce, cold greasy cheese. Ninja turtles not impressed. Go back to pizza class.
author: Len C.

description: Went here late at night...OMG. Best pizza I have ever had in SF. I just moved here from the east coast and the Castro special is amazing!
author: Genesis G.

description:
Perfect way to end a clubbing night at The Cafe in The Castro. They are opened until 2am!

For $4 you can order the Castro and get a humongous slice of chicken and pesto pizza. It was gooood.
author: Alice X.

description:
Located at the intersection of intoxicated and insobriety, Nizario's Pizza is a welcome rest stop amidst all the bars in Castro to sober up and get some much needed nosh. Oh and the slices are yummy too. 

You can have your cheese or pepperoni slices but I really like The Castro slice - spinach, pesto, feta, and chicken. It's a delicious combination on a crispy crust. The Nizario's Special is a meaty slice if you so desire. On weekday vegetarian nights for me, a simple slice of pesto just hits the right comforting spots. 

Nizario's Pizza is a welcome counterpoint to the heavy pours of Castro bartenders. For that, many a drinking night in the area probably warrants a quick pit stop here before heading home.
author: Jon L.

description:
Just got done eating here for the first time. Wow is their pizza good! Found it by accident searching for something quick but filling to eat in between work appointments. 

I ordered the San Francisco Special...I was so happy I didn't get just a slice! The pizza was full of flavor, fluffy and I even ate the crust, which I never do. Wish I had one where I live!
author: Dania D.

description: Stop by for a slice of drunk pizza on a Thursday night. This slice was different than the ones I usually find in New England. It wasn't quite thick crust but wasn't thin either. Solid slice if you are in the area.
author: Michael C.

description: I usually order by the slice here, which is roughly $3-4 per slice. Its a pretty good sized slice, and quite tasty. Usually I venture here while out drinking, since they are open late. Actually, I only tend to go here when I'm drunk, but thats more because its conveniently located across from a bar. Still, when your out on the town, this is a good place to stop and put some food in your stomach.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Man, this place is awesome! Another SF establishment that did not disappoint me! :) Since my friend and I are Yelp obsessed, lol, he said one of his friends, and of course Yelp said this was one of the best pizza places in San Fran. Also, Nizario's is in the Castro District, so that's a plus already! How can you not love Castro, haha!

I ordered the Castro special which is chicken, feta cheese, spinach, and pesto. I almost didn't order it, because the spinach in the picture looked overpowering, but it was so delicious! It was also extra cheesy,  and you know how I love cheese, yyyyyyuuuuuummmmmmm!!!!!

My pizza slice did take sort of a long time to come out, and I was getting a little annoyed at the gentlemen working there, since I was freakin hungry! but overall delicious pizza, definitely worth the wait. :) They also gave us a free Coke, which was very nice.  You can't help but love the Castro district!
author: Jeanette S.

description:
After much testing, I've come to the conclusion that Nizario's (particularly the Castro Special) is SPECTACULAR, beyond delicious, fulfiller of all cravings, smile and burp inducing....when I'm DRUNK.  

However, when I'm sober, the pizza is disappointing and leaves me wondering if I just had a bad batch...but that happens every time I have a sober slice.  Am I just that delirious when I'm buzzin' that my taste buds are as weak as my hands' grips on my personal items?  

Drunk score: 5 stars
Sober score: 2 stars
Overall: 3.5 (rounded down to 3 bc I can't do halfsies)
author: Heidi L.

description:
Nizario's is "Old Reliable"... always great slices of pizza (my favorite is The Castro Pizza) and open 'till late.

The style of pizza they serve definitely isn't Neapolitan, Chicago nor New York.  I guess they're better described as, for lack of a better description, "Castro Style".

The crust is technically a thin crust, but a bit on the thicker, breadier side.  The ingredients are top notch and the cheese doesn't run oily at all (a sign of good quality).  You know you just had a good slice of pizza when your paper plate isn't completely transparent at the end of the meal.
author: Rico O.

description: This place is a joke... the pizza is ok but the service is trash!! customer service goes a long way... and the mexican/ latin guy the have preparing the pizza is nasty... he eats food, touches on everything, touches his hair, then touches your food with his bare nasty hands... very unsanitary this is a health issue... God knows what he is putting in the food... the health department meeds to be called there are so many violations going on in this place... if I could give no star I would
author: T.l. J.

description:
A slice of pepperoni ($2.75); a slice of Hawaiian ($3.00); a good Supercombo slice of pizza ($4) and I wasn't even that hungry. The toppings were more than the average drop-in pizzeria. The crust was not too thin nor thick, but just about right. Don't see why I wouldn't stop by here the next time in the area and without food plans. Barely half a block away from the BofA you can spot at the intersection of Market and Castro streets.

Bonus review: "Halloween in the Castro" is no longer the same as those from years ago. While it is still fun and was crowded with odd-costumed revelers, it's a bit different now - safer in a way. No more massive crowds - on the streets and sidewalks (now it's just on the sidewalks). No more blaring dance music/DJ stages in the middle of the streets (now it's just music coming from the bars). At least no more thugs and troublemakers (now it's just the SFPD).
author: Peter L.

description:
3.5 stars

I'd hate to break the solid 4 star reviews here, but last night my pizza was just alright.

Their pizza by the slice ranges from $2.75 to $4.   

My Combo pizza had salami, sausage and mushrooms.  I like the thick crust, although it was a bit chewy (must've been sitting a while), they didn't skimp on the toppings, definitely cheesy but not too much sauce.

On the other hand, the bf had the $4 Castro special (which came right out of the oven) was perfect!  Lots of cubed chicken, spinach, pesto and feta cheese.  

If you've got the pizza cravings late at night, they are open until 2 am. You can't go wrong by ordering the Castro special and the service is quite fast here at Nizario's.
author: Janice C.

description: Not much selection, but the pizza is good for the price. The Castro Special is probably the best thing to get, other than that the pizza is OK. Not somethig i would go out of my way for.
author: Mya M.

description: The best pizza in the Castro!  Anytime I'm in the neighborhood I make it a point to grab a slice or two
author: David M.

description: I like this place.... They tell you it will be ready in 45mins and it is never had any issues with delivery. I usually order there garlic chicken pesto that pizza is delicious very filling.
author: Rene L.

description: A great little hole in the wall pizza joint.  Fresh slices always ready and never more than a 2 minute wait.  Friendly staff and they are open hella late.
author: Sonny G.

description:
This is a sober review... LOL

the pizza selection was lacking, especially for a vegetarian, but I still enjoyed my cheese slice before heading out. 
-the bread to cheese to sauce ration was good
-cheese was gooey enough
-crust had a little flavor
-service was quick and with a smile

maybe if i was drunk i would have added another star... LOL
author: Leticia G.

description:
We used to like Nizario's.  A lot.  Then they got rid of the combo that we liked the best, but worse yet they cut back on their pepperoni.  Nizario's is not the only guilty party here unfortunately.

Would it kill the 3 by-the-slice pizzerias in the Castro to put more than a hint of pepperoni on their pepperoni slices?  It's like a race to the bottom - each has less pepperoni per slice than the others.  I don't know yet if this is a San Francisco-wide phenomenon, or just collusion by the Castro by-the-slice pizzerias in wringing the last few pennies out of the Castro partiers and ignoring the people who live in the area who would gladly pay more to frequent a local establishment that puts more than just a courtesy dash of pepperoni on their individual slices.
author: Toby V.

description: I come here on a regular basis whether it's for a meal or a drunken hunger binge. Pizza is always Fresh and hottt! Simple easy to read menu and very reasonably priced. Highly recommend! Staff is friendly and makes you feel welcome!
author: Maurice S.

description:
After a night of drinking, one thing was on our minds today: pizza...oh, and sleep...but pizza being the most important, of course ;P

Not too many pizza joints are open in the middle of the afternoon, so thanks to Yelp I stumbled upon Nizario's. It's probably been a good 3-4 years since I've had a slice of pizza from Nizario's and I was not disappointed!

We ordered the Nizario's special - pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, onions & bell peppers. We wanted delicious, no-frills pizza and that's exactly what we got! A 12 inch pie was $12.90 and they have free and fast delivery.

Definitely a great option whether you are in the Castro or craving pizza on a lazy Sunday afternoon.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I love you Nizaro's.  After a fancy shamncy meal across the street at Poesia.. in which I was not fully satisfied.  I ordered a slice of the veggie pizza to go.  The husband ordered a plain cheese.  It totally hit the spot.  It was only $6.25 for both slices.. 

The pizza at Nizaro's has the perfect amount of cheese, sauce, toppings and bread/crust.  If I could choose, I would guess Nizaro's would be better then Seniore's possibly because its healthier; less crust = less calories?  Not sure hahahaa.. but I'd pick Nizaro's regardless.  It was pretty tasty.
author: Alice E.

description:
I LOVE Nizarios's!! I think this is truly my favorite pizza place in the Bay (why? because I say so).

Soooo yummy. The Castro slice is the best, followed by the Hawaiian. Outside of that, I'm sure it's good, but I've never had any other slice.

Also, I love the staff - they care enough to flirt with me, and that is good customer service.
author: Jason B.

description: Drunk pizza runs in the Castro.. Doesn't get any better!
author: Dee L.

description:
The crust has the right "chew" to it, but (at least) the cheese pizza is completely flavorless. If a pizza place can't get a plain cheese pizza right, it doesn't bode well for others.

I don't know how this place stays in business given that there are two MUCH better pizza places within a block, namely Escape from New York (Castro/18th) and Marcello's (Castro/17th).
author: Paul L.

description:
I love this place...especially after a night of drinking at the nearby bars/clubs.  

Pizza = hot, tasty and a bit greasy (hey, it's the cheese, man!)

Service = get in and get out.
author: Fannie S.

description:
For some reason.....
Their greasy, big slice of pizza was suuuuuper duuuuper good after shots ot tequila. Yes.

My friend got a pepperoni, and i took a bite. I had no intentions of getting my own..but after that bite....i walked up to the counter right away and got my own slice of cheese pizza.

It was good. And cheap.
author: Monica H.

description: THE place to get pizza in the Castro. Their slices are generous and the staff is efficient. It's not like you'll have a choice when you and your friends are stumbling down from Badlands, but these guys do you right.
author: Patrick M.

description: I cannot vouch for Nizario's before 10pm, but after a night at the Mix or Lookout, or a BART ride to those establishments, I always enjoy a slice.  Quick, not too pricey, and you can eat outside as you walk.  YAY NIZARIO'S!!!
author: Dick S.

description:
In a drunken haze, I was led to Nizario's in an attempt to "sober up," whatever that is. Even in a stupor, I know what I like and Nizario's didn't quite meet that expectation.

First and foremost, when I pay $4.00 for a slice a pizza, I expect a rather large slice of pizza from a "hole in the wall" joint. You want to keep me as a customer, don't you? THEN FEED ME. My $4.00 slice was medium sized, but you would think that businesses would step up their game, especially in this economy. I am used to getting a 1/6 of a rather large pizza for around $2.00, so receiving an 1/8 of a pizza for double the cost seems like a rip off!

Whatever. I paid it. Time to sink my teeth into it. 

Maybe it was the cold. Maybe it was my altered state. Maybe not many people were eating the same pizza as me (after all, I am a vegetarian and there were pretty much only men in the place, so you KNOW they were all eating the MEAT pizzas), but my pizza tasted like it was under a heat lamp for some time -- not fresh at all. I ate part of the crush of my friend's meat pizza (a part that was not contaminated), and I really tasted the difference between fresh and not-so-fresh. My veg combo pizza was the latter.

The crowd was consistent the whole 30 minutes I was there. There was a crowd of cute Filippino boys who will hella chismis-ing, and I totally entered their conversation and gave them some good comeback lines. Needless to say, they loved me. Duh.

Any who, the place was ok: not dirty nor clean -- it's a walk-thru pizzeria. There is a little area for the pizza sprinkles stuff (Parmesan cheese, chili, salt'n'pepper, whatever) right next to the register, so that made it really easy to decorate my pizza right when I got it -- not like it was fresh though... psh.

I would say something about Nizario's being open late, but I realized that I'm pretty much a grandma when it comes to staying out late, and what felt like 1 am, was really only 10 pm.
author: Nicole P.

description:
That's 4 drunken stars.  In reality/sobriety, I actually have no idea what the pizza here tastes like.

Jk!  It is sometimes the highlight of a night out.  Do I remember what song was played at a club we went to?  No.  Do I remember how delicious the melted cheese and pesto tasted at 2 in the morning?  I most certainly think I kind of do.

Their pizza is so drunk-good that my friend dropped it on the ground, picked it up, and almost ate it before we stopped him.  "It was only one seccconnndddd," he said, but we knew that 1) it was more than a second and 2) gross regardless.  But anyway, THAT'S how drunk-good Nizario's is.
author: jon y.

description: This place is open almost like a 7-11.  I have no clue what time they close down?  But after going to the bars, my friends wanted to come here to have the pizza soak up the booze action.  Prices were about $2.75 and up per slice.  But I didn't think the pizza was all that great.  Kind of bland.  Oh well, good to know if you need to grab a bite to eat after getting your drink on in the Castro.  Ca$h only!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Pizza selection is okay, but then again I only come during the late hours of the night assuming they don't have much of a selection at this time.  

Otherwise, it's the best place to get pizza after a night of club hopping and drunken shenanigans :D
author: Melanie A.

description: The go to pizza!  The Castro special is quite possibly one of my favorite pizzas!  Always consistent! Tons of spinach, pesto, feta, chicken, not too much cheese, solid crust! Open late,  free delivery!  Yum!
author: Chi chi R.

description:
A night of hella drinking and dancing in the Castro always ends with me at Nizario's eating hella pizza. 

I love Nizario's. The Castro Special is definitely my favorite. Spinach, chicken and pesto never tasted so good (while drunk). 
I love the crust, and I feel the amount of sauce and cheese is perfect.

This is such a dangerous place. First of all, I always manage to get too drunk when I'm in the Castro, and as soon as I see Nizario's I end up eating too much pizza, resulting in a very shitty morning. 

 I do have to admit my favorite thing about this place is the music. They're ALWAYS bumping some crazy ass house, techno and electro. The music here is better than at most of the clubs. I can't help but dance if I'm eating inside. 

Oh, and if you're chilling at the Mix across the street, feel free to go across the street, get a slice of pizza and eat it at the Mix.
author: Brian S.

description: Very friendly and fast delivery. However, my review is for the pizza not the service. Pizza was ok. The sauce really needs work. The crust is too thick. Taste is bland and when you ask for ranch they give you a pre packaged packet. Nothing special. I've had frozen pizzas with more flavor.
author: Sonia R.

description: Great pizza for after a night in Castro! Cool crowd in there as well! The pizza was fresh and fast and priced right when you've spent the night drinking and only have a few bucks left. I recommend this place and would like to try some of their other pizzas next time we visit.
author: Kelsey H.

description: It's a pizza slice place, y'know? Kinda dirty, next to Midnight Sun. The Castro slice is the way to go. They are fast. The crust is on the thicker side. I think it rates up there with Marcello's. One slice will be enough.
author: Aaron W.

description: When it's 2am, and you've just left the club and are still kind of drunk, it's delicious. In retrospect, I realized it was kind of pricey. It was really good pizza, I'm just not sure if it was worth 4 dollars a slice.  It was cool that the huge line formed after we were sitting enjoying our pizza, but that was just pure luck.
author: Ruth R.

description: 2 stars because already this pizza is only decent when you're hammered, but more so I'm giving 2 stars because last night the cashier deliberately gave my friend and I incorrect change - two separate transactions. I've worked registers in restaurants before and have seen this done , but have never had it done to me until last night. $7 for pizza.. I give you $20.. You confidently hand me a $5 and 3 singles.. Lets revisit that math considering you've shorted me $5. And had just done the same to my friend. Not cool my friend.
author: Matthew C.

description:
I'm vegan. Or at least, I'm normally vegan.
And then I met Nizario's Pizza.
And now, I'm vegan except for my once monthly splurge on their amazing pesto cheese pizza. I always take one slice home, and before I've finished my walk home I've eaten the massive slice and I'm upset I didn't either 1. savor it or 2. buy a second slice.
author: Megan C.

description: Not sure what changed but I won't be coming here anymore. Was there an ownership change ?  Staff is different and not friendly. Never have the slices I want and  it doesn't taste as good. Good thing there are other options.
author: Bill L.

description:
After nearly 3 months in SF and not having a single good slice, I'm on a quest to find a slice that would be considered 'good' in NYC. First stop, Nizario's.

The joint itself is nothing special (though it doesn't need to be) with limited seating and one counter. They only offer a few types of slices, including a Castro Special. Generally I like a smaller selection, which implies mastery of those items.

I got a slice of mushroom, and was generally underwhelmed. The crust is french-bread style and the sauces/cheese was not memorable. The slice also wasn't re-heated to a good temperature, so it was cool by the time I finished. 

Won't be returning, onto the next place.
author: Scott L.

description:
One of my best friends kept raving about this "Nizario's Pizza," but I never really took her seriously. 

Then I tried their super combo pizza (Their version of supreme pizza). Hands down the best pizza I have ever had - no other pizza place compares! Weirdly enough, the other Nizarios in the richmond doesn't even compare.

The slice is pretty big and costs around $4.00

They once had chairs with their tables, but the last time I went (Feb 2011), there were only tables. So, you have to stand and eat your pizza (or take it out to the curb).

The lines can get pretty long when the bars let out so if you're one of those people who hit the bars and get a bite to eat afterwards, I would suggest leaving just a little before the bars close to beat the rush.
author: Wendy M.

description: I know it's like the ritual place to go since it's right by Badlands, Toad Hall, and the Mix, but honestly Escape from New York blows this place out of the water. The pizza crust here is way drier than it should be and the crust/topping ratio is off. Always a fat line too.
author: Kevin L.

description:
yes yes yes! late, by the slice, delicious specials. I got the castro special. It was SO good. thin but not too crispy crust. Hot. but not too hot. The pizza I've been searching for the past few weeks, FINALLY was in my mouth.
the. best. walking. discovery. ever.
author: Lexie L.

description:
I can't tell if I like it or not. I keep ordering the Castro slice because people tell me it's the best, but I am still on the fence. Chicken and pesto... Eh... 

It's good when it's fresh, but not good if they are heating it up. I think the slices are a little on the small side for $4, but when you are drunk does it really matter...
author: Minh V.

description: Late night pizza in the Castro. Pesto pizza was tasty. I wonder if it's better later at night and after hanging out in the Castro?
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Castro pizza is a very personal thing. Between Marcello's, Escape from NY and Nizario's, everyone has their favorite. (Guess which one isn't mine?)

Most of us eat it when we're blitzed in the wee hours of the morning, and Nizario's has the benefit (or rather, the strategy) of being open later than most. I've been here many times, and while the pizza is decent, it just isn't my favorite in the 'hood. The crust is so doughy, and the per-slice price isn't really that great of a deal. 

Four drinks in I'll eat here in a pinch, but at that point it's not really about getting great pizza, is it?
author: Aaron L.

description: THE BEST pizza in the Castro & possibly San Fran in general. They're open late every night (2am or later) & it is the hottest spot on the weekends for everyone to grab a slice. Free delivery too! It's a must go for anyone! P.S- Their pesto chicken is to die for.
author: Peyton S.

description:
If the hot dog lady ain't out on the street, this is the place to go. Hit up this pizza joint for all your drunk munchy needs.

This place has all types of pizzas to meet your needs, other than the super combo, the next best thing is the castro pizza.

Have munchies at the end of the night. Solve it with Nizario's!
author: Mark L.

description:
Two words: Castro pizza. Yes please! 
Okay so I guess more like four words. 

This was the perfect end after a night of dancing at The Cafe. My friends got the Hawaiian pizza which was also pretty amazing. There weren't any chairs inside the restaurant and I didn't like the idea of standing after my feet were dying from my shoes, but i got over the pain pretty quickly cause the pizza was just that darn good.
author: Leslie K.

description:
Here's the deal' this is where you go after shutting down the castro bars at 2am with all your friends on any given night. The food is pretty decent, the staff is fairly nice and the prices are fair.

Besides that though, this place is definitely something that can be looked over, I must say. If you aren't drunk off your ass at 2am, then you deserve better pizza, for sure. But for being conveniently placed in the heart of The Castro and having great hours AND (cute little side note) welcoming their after 2am guests with cranked up party music, this place gets three stars just for that.
author: Trav M.

description:
Castro Special is all you need to know. Every ingredient blends together perfectly to create this little slice of heaven in your mouth. The workers are friendly too! They let us in half an hour after closing because we looked hungry (which we were) and they still had pizza to sell. If you have a late night case of the after-clubbing munchies this place fits the bill.

Summary: 4/5 stars
+Castro Special.
+Friendly workers
-Combo was nothing to write home about
author: Daniel M.

description:
The drunken adventures I have to share from this shithole are endless.

Let me just say, kudos for being such smart business owners to stay open until after the bars close... Because this is really the only way and reason they get 99% of their business. Escape from new York around the corner which has WAY better pizza needs to open its eyes and realize they are making the dumbest business decision by closing so early in a neighborhood that breathers and lives during the after hours like Castro!

Nizario's pizza is absolutely gross. Just go during the day and you'll be able to tell why... it is dead. Queens who live in the Castro are sober and know better not to get anywhere near this shoebox hole in the wall during the daylight.

Service here is awful but the poor quality of the overpriced slice of pizza and expired rotten parmesan cheese on the side does it for me.

Alcohol intoxication is not a good enough reason for me to stumble upon this crack house... I must be on either crystal meth or crack to end up here..

Pepperoni pizza: awful
Cheese pizza: couldn't be more blend
Castro pizza: overpriced and always out

Do they have anything else on their menu? No


STAY AWAY!
author: NC B.

description: The pizza here is great! I had the Castro slice and it was very flavorful and greasy. I'm sure this place gets very busy during after hours.
author: Kristina N.

description:
AMAZING PIZZA!!! Friends and I walked over after hours of drinking and boy, this definitely satisfied our cravings. They close everyday at 2am and last night, we got there around 2:24 AM. One of the guys working there told us to just come in and we bought whatever was left: COMBO AND THE CASTRO SPECIAL. 

I think I liked the castro special better than the combo. I loved the pesto and feta cheese mix. The crust was perfecto! Not too doughy and not super thin; it also had a great crunch factor. The combo was pretty okay (I think it got better tasting after awhile haha). The pepperonis were so good! I don't know why, but I felt as though that was best pepperoni I've had on a pizza HAHA. I actually don't remember what else was on the combo but it also had a pretty darn good crust.
author: Faye F.

description: And that's the way you end the night. Do you really care how it tastes? Probably won't remember in the morning anyway (unless you're the unfortunate role of the DD.) not bad not bad... service was quick, nothing to complain of. Other patrons were friendly and conversational.
author: Naomi K.

description: Ah yeah, pizza fan I am! There is nothing like a nice fat slice of pizza late at night after an evening of alcohol and music. Short and simply put, the crust was perfection: thick and doughy with a crisp crunch on the outside. The cheese ever so melty and gooey and what else can I say except I took that slice all the way into the emergency room, that the check in nurse looked at me all crazy. Yes, it was that good. About the e.r., that's ahem... another blog.
author: Sharon B.

description:
I'm really surprised by the positive reviews here.  I'm no pizza snob, but this place is awful.  The slices I got were chewy (not in a good way) and bland.  Unfriendly service.  Dirty.  Boring pizza. 
It's cheap, I guess, but still not worth it.  This is my first one star review.  I really hope there is better pizza in SF, because that great city deserves better than Nizario's.
author: Kirby S.

description:
Are you drunk?

Hungry?

In the castro?

well I have found the perfect after clubbing dining place, and it is sooooooooooooooo tasty!!! I like cheese pizza, and their cheese pizza and veggie pizza were soooooooooo delicious!!!
author: Nina M.

description:
My friend wanted to grab a quick bite and said this pizza joint was good so we stopped by here after a night out on the town. We just got out of Badlands Bar and Nizario's was just across the street.

She ordered a cheese pizza for $2.75 which is a pretty good deal! We shared it and I usually don't do cheese pizzas but I enjoyed Nizario's. The pizza was nice and crisp. It was very tasty and cheesy as well!

Good stuff!
author: Darryl P.

description: Maybe i was just drunk, but damn that pesto slice was delicious.
author: Elena F.

description: Every time I come here I get the pesto slice.  Yet, I'll be honest, my slice while doughy and delicious is never completely warm.  Yes, I'll say it.  The more I have imbibed, the less I care, but seriously, boys, heat those slices right.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Awesome pizza and it's open late for all the drunk revelers.  The workers are generally pretty friendly.  

My only thing is that I think pizza prices in general are a bit high.  Here, a piece of pesto pizza is around $4, while cheese is around $2.75, so it's not too bad.
author: D. M.

description:
The best pizza ever after drinking the night away in the castro! ive tried this place a few times sober... but its much tastier drunk!  I love the castro special and usually get that and a slice of pepperoni! Its great it stays open so late... I think it closes at 3am.  Weekends prepare for a line up out the door with the gays hungry for a slice of these pies!  Nizario's your fattening me up!  

Ive come here so much that when I went to the Nizario's in North Beach... the guy taking my order says to me "I know you, you always go to the castro location"
author: Jasen L.

description: The best pizza I've ever eaten. I drive all the way from the east bay just to eat here. Love their hawaiian pizza.
author: Ish A.

description:
Simply awesome pizza at a good price (very tasty)! If your in the Castro and want a slice of pizza this place is for you. 

Only downside, is the place could use a renovation to update the sitting area, and expand their beverage selections.
author: Justin B.

description:
We love to snack along wherever we are, especially in a neighborhood we have not visited in the past.

After a jerk took our space from behind, we drove around again and eventually found an even better space - that's karma.  Anyway, we were a little hungry but didn't want to commit to anywhere until we see what's available.  Well, a slice of pizza never hurts and we'll be sharing.  There was only one person there and the tv was on.  While we looked, somebody else came in and we let them go first since we were undecided.

We got the vegetarian slice ($3.50).  We waited a few minutes for it to be heated but wish they heated it just another minute or two more.  The crust was crispy and the flavor was good but it was just warm so the cheese didn't pull, which is always the best part.  Anyway, I'm glad they have everything I like to sprinkle on my pizza - garlic powder, pepper flakes, Italian herbs, parmesan cheese and even black pepper.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Visiting family and in town for a couple days

Stopped by here on the way back to the hotel. Really good pizza and cheap too (considering how expensive SF is). Tried the pesto and pepperoni pizza. LOVED the pesto, wish there was a place in Vegas that had it. Great hole-in-the-wall vibe with partiers from the neighboring bars coming over to grab a slice. If I lived here I would be back often.
author: Patrick T.

description: I think that in the Castro you're divided in 2 pizza camps: Nizario's or Escape from New York.  My vote is for Nizario's.  Although they're never the friendliest at this pizza palor, you truly can't beat one of their slices  (especially late night after a evening full of drinking)!
author: Sean H.

description: Best pizza in the world.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I love this place!!! Was there at 1am still open. Pizza was hot and fresh. 
Not many tables inside but that's ok I don't mind the fresh pizza scent :)
author: Lucky M.

description:
After the salty craving and after the sweet craving there is the *I durno but I just want to keep eating* craving.  Pizza was the food item of choice.  Our first choice, Little Star on Divisadero, was closed!  The runner up, Patxi's Chicago Pizza...CLOSED ALSO!  Oh lordy lordy.

And so it was that we ended up at Nizario's.  There is nothing wrong with Nizario's Pizza.  Nothing at all.  It's good pizza.  I mean, much like a blowjob, pizza can never be that bad even when it doesn't make your toes curl and eyes roll back into your head...
author: Luis M.

description:
I'm torn on Nizario's.  It's like four steps from my apartment.  That means that I pretty much eat every single meal here.  What can I say?  I'm a lazy bitch.

But it isn't very good.  I'd venture to say that the other two places on Castro St. are better.  It's just that I hate those extra few steps it takes to get there.  Thus I go to Nizario's.

And you know what?  This bitch stays open LATE.  Seriously if you want to pick up a drunk gay boy or a tranny prostitute at 2 a.m. this is the place to be!!!!

Oh, actually I might have something positive to say.  A first, I know.  This pizza is the best in the Castro for soaking up alcohol because its hella greasy and like 99% bread.  Loves it.
author: Evan L.

description:
3-star pizza joint by day, 4-star "sober me up" joint by night!

Open late!  Thank goodness!

I was fairly hammered walking in here after The Bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-bar-on-castro-san-francisco#hrid:-mdv-OjmHLp-q49Tft859w) and it seemed everyone on Castro had the same idea.  Luckily we arrived just before the rush.  The place quickly got crowded and noisy, where this isn't so much a place to eat before going home as it was a last opportunity to make some magic happen!

The pizza is less than ideal; grease and a not-so-thin crust make for a saggy slice.  But for its lesser quality, it is cheap and does a grand job of coating the tummy and soaking up alcohol; I woke up this morning feeling like heck... but less like heck than I normally would.

Yet again, somewhere I need to try in a less inebriated state, but off the top of my head, its a decent slice with okay tastes...  plus I had already had a GREAT slice earlier in the night at Marcello's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/marcellos-pizza-san-francisco#hrid:FfqnMS16PhYcXucWnIscgA)
_____________________
Pizza... almost any pizza... is GOLDEN at 2:00 in the morning...
author: Mikey U.

description:
The first time I went here after some late night struttin' at the Castro, it was during the spinach/e.coli controversy.  I was disappointed because I feared ordering the Castro Special slice (chicken, spinach, feta, pesto), so I opted for the traditional Pepperoni slice.  

I was super satisfied with the pepperoni slice....

(fastforward 6 months)

Perhaps from my initial satiation with the Quickly fried foods, I was not too ecstatic about the Castro Special. I was already rather full, but it was still a good slice.  Not the greatest, but still a good slice.
author: Grace M.

description:
I've lived in the Castro for over ten years now but used to visit the Avenues a lot and that is where I first got my taste for Nizario's pizza.  They were always open late and we would stumble there from the bars for some sliced goodness.

I had forgotten that they opened up one near my house in the Castro so I called one day and didn't know what to order so we got the Castro special.  Oh boy, we don't order anything else now.  Nizario's is one of the best and no snobby stoner kids running the registers.
author: Steve P.

description:
Castro has no shortage of grab'n'go pizza places, that's for sure.  Methinks it may have to do with providing fuel for the bargoers (the fact that Nizario's hours are 3 PM - 2 AM is another clue).  Of course, I'm unlikely to be drinking the night away in these parts anytime soon, so I stopped in on a weekend afternoon instead.  And boy is this place barebones, even by the standards of its kind (3 2-stool tables and a standing-only counter).  So while I prefer to eat sitting down, I think you'll really enjoy the pizza more while strolling down some victorian-lined street nearby.  

But anyway, the important thing is the pizza itself.  First, kudos on the Castro Special--a chicken-pesto pizza that doesn't overdo it on the pesto.  Crust could've been pillowier, though.  Oh yeah, and it needed to be hotter.  Overall, it beats Marcello's but not Escape From New York, although if I'm going to EFNY might as well go to the Haight.  The real question is whether the Richmond Nizario's is any different--it's farther from home, but some of the reviews suggest the quality is better, and at any rate I'm far more likely to drunkenly stumble by it some night.
author: Wes M.

description: Pizza was not NY style, was thick & mediocre in taste. Service was good. It is open late. I would still go to Arinell's.
author: Mihir M.

description: Pizza had serious potential but was so cold I felt like I was eating something from the Safeway frozen food isle.
author: Bianca F.

description:
If there's a prevention for a hangover...Nizario's Pizza is thee preventative measure. I've stumbled in here many -o- times late at night after that last call for alcohol then the bars kicking you out into the street.

It's like routine to many as the line swarms out the door here.  That sidewalk sale that died down in front of the BOC or the Sadlands has magically reappeared at the foot of Nizario's Pizza.  No, not the greatest pizza in San Francisco, but with late night eateries a slim option within walking distance from where you just slammed that quart sized Long Island Iced Tea, it makes this place look like the nightingale of the neighborhood.  

Thank you for serving the community...not sending drunks that don't need to be on the road right after last call, and preventing that room from spinning before you go to bed.

Oh, and to you skinny bitches in the Castro wedged in those skinny pegged jeans ...eat something!
author: B H.

description:
Is everyone crazy??? 4 Stars??? 

 This is some of the worst pizza I have ever had. 

Its more like bread sticks than pizza. Minimal Sauce. Minimal Cheese. 

If your from CA maybe this is acceptable, but if  your from the east coast dont bother with this one.
author: chris b.

description:
Mmm, this is the best pizza in SF. I love stopping in to grab a slice for lunch. The pizza has a nice balance of sauce and toppings. My favorites are the pepperoni and mushroom slices. The cheese doesn't fall into my face and the sauce isn't too messy.

They don't open until 1 p.m., which can be a downer. Yet, they stay open late until around 3 a.m., which is most def. a picker upper after a rowdy night out. Parking can be tricky, but worth a slice.

The guys who work here are also pretty nice. This place can get busy late night and they manage to keep up the pace with the crowd.
author: Marcelina B.

description:
There is absolutely nothing better than stumbling into Nizario's at 1:30 am with makeup smeared across my face from dancing my ass off all night. It's almost become a ritual to stop by and have a slice whenever my best friend and I are in the castro. 

We went to the Castro Theater for the Sound of Music Sing-a-long and did not have time to sit down and eat. I grabbed a greko special slice(feta, garlic, pesto, olives) and the best friend got a california castro special slice(pesto, chicken, feta, spinach) and it was so comforting to stand in that cold, long line with our pizza. We washed in down with some root beer and was sat-is-fied.

After hitting The Cafe or Badlands, I am usually drunk, dehydrated and half asleep. On those nights, nothing hits the spot like their vegetarian special (mushrooms, bell peppers, onion, tomato.)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
MMmmm, okay so I was drunk, but this pizza was awesome!  I don't even know what I had... maybe the Hawaiin?  I know my roommate had the Castro special and then we had a loud drunken discussion about how "fucking awesome" our pizza slices were.  The parmesan cheese went missing, but there was a dirty paper plate with some cheese dumped on it, so we used that.  Then my friend Jose ran into the head cheerleader from his high school, and we laughed for awhile about how hillarious that was, for some reason.

It feels like a dream, but it was so real...
author: Laura W.

description:
Castro special please!...I heard the hell outta that!  this is where you have to come to get a slice of pizza to bring down the buzz after a night of drinking in the Stro!  Open late most nights.

Staying home? they deliver too!
author: A P.

description: I love this pizza when I am in the area. This place stays open late and is located in a busy area of the Castro.This place is very small if you plan on wanting a sit down probably not the best place, although there are two small bar tables inside. The guy in at the registar is usually nice, I am sure he has to deal with a lot of drunks and partiers at 1am from the local bars there. When I am in the mood for pizza after a night out I make my way here to Nazario's. I have been to the Geary location and did not like the pizza there nor the service. Hey it's open late night and they have decent pizza for both when your drinking or not.
author: X X.

description:
This is exactly what I needed after hanging out at the Cafe.  I was a little disappointed that they had run out of Italian sausage and so I asked for pepperoni.  They had run out of that too.  I will give them some leeway on this, as it was, 2 a.m. afterall.

So, I ended up chowing down on a veggie pizza slice.  Surprisingly enough, they didn't skimp on the veggies.  It was like a mini-salad on my pizza slice.  Plus, the slice itself was rather impressive.  I couldn't finish my slice and I'm a finisher.

That quick bite before heading back home was a great way to finish off a crazy night.  Plus, the people there are good enough to let you use the tiny bathroom in the back...that made me really happy.
author: Adrienne P.

description:
Shortly after moving here from NY, I went bar hopping in the Castro with a friend who had moved here from NY less than a year prior.  When we left the last bar sometime after 1 am he turned to me and said "Ok.  Now is when all the boys head over to Nizario's for a slice.  Their pizza's really good.  Just like home.  You'll like it."  Cool.

So we head over and get in line with hundreds of other homos needing a slice or two soak up the alcohol in our bellies.   After the first bite I turned to my friend and said, "When was the last time you were home?  This doesn't taste anything like New York."  Basically, the dough is just really thick.  

But, no, I am not going to write another "why can't anyone make NY style pizza in SF?" review.  I've given up and accepted it.  And its all good.  The same friend who introduced me to Nizario's also taught me this valuable lesson, "Jeff, this is not New York and its never going to be New York.  So, the sooner you accept it, the happier you are going to be here."  He was so right.  And, now, I love it here in San Francisco and  no longer expect to find NY pizza here (although I feel that Arinell & Marcello's are the closest).  And, that's okay.

What I do love about Nizario's is that their pepperoni is usually well done, just like I like it.
author: Jeff P.

description: The pizza here is good even when you're not ordering a slice drunk off of your ass in the middle of the night. It was tasty even when I was a little tipsy in the middle of the afternoon. I had a piece of pepperoni. Can't go wrong right? It was great. A friend ordered a slice of the pesto pizza and made the mistake of offering me and our 3 other buddies a bite. We all ended up attacking it. The dining area is shit and the guys who work there aren't very friendly, but who gives a damn. Just hand the guy your money and walk out the door with a good slice.
author: Isaac S.

description:
They take visa over the phone but not inside.

They are friendly to you if you have big tits.

They aren't honest, and it's only good when you're drunk. Try going there when you're sober...its a sobering experience all in itself.
author: Andy D.

description:
2AM Friday night after a few drinks at the Elbo Room called for yummy greasy pizza... THANK YOU Nizario's for always coming through!

The workers are efficient and work quickly to ensure the line of hungry buzzed  patrons get their slices fast.

Funny, though... just realized I've usually been tipsy when wolfing down a slice... perhaps that's what makes it taste so good???
author: Nenette Y.

description: I called to see if they deliver to my boyfriend's house and they put me on hold. When he got back on the line, he asked for the address and phone number. I told him I wanted to make sure he delivers before I order. He yells and say "we don't deliver to your area. Bye.'' Before I could ask why, he hangs up. How rude!!
author: Serena F.

description:
I stumbled in here one night, blindly drunk at 2 AM.  I ordered my two slices and stumbled back out bumping my pizza box into a guy walking in.  He turned and said something mildly antagonizing.  I took the bait and we soon found ourselves wrestling in the gutter in some drunken fight to the amazement of his friends.  He got up, apologized, gave me a hug, and walked back in.

A fight over a piece of pizza.  It's good pizza, though not worth fighting over.
author: Evan A.

description:
Just moved back to the city and all I can say is "YUM"

Many times has this little joint been the after party of the midnight hour.  And after enough trips to the front of the line, i already know the drill... "Castro Special!" So Good, perhaps not the healthiest, but at that time of night, it's not like anyone is looking to watch their waist line. I'm a Fan!
author: Richard C.

description:
While it seems like they're skimping just a little bit on the tomato sauce these days, it's still my favorite pizza in town.  Great crust!  Best fresh out of the oven.  

I've been to 3 different locations in SF, and the service is ALWAYS quick and accurate.  While they seem to be always task-focused, there is an underlying emphasis on customer service and customer appreciation.  They take pride in doing what they do well.

My office colleagues thanked me when I figured out the North Beach location will deliver to the financial district for lunch.  They all agree that Nizario's is way better than the other two places we used to order from for work lunches.  And even better, they really seemed to appreciate the extra business.
author: Andrew S.

description: Nice hole in the wall pizza place after a hard night's work of clubbing in the Castro.. Prices are cheap (especially for the city) and the slices are huge!
author: Christine L.

description: Great name for a pizza place.  $3 for a pesto slice.  I usually have cheese but in this case I went with Pesto because pesto is my favorite.  It was a very good piece of pizza just too fat for a good score on my list though.
author: Jeff J.

description: OK . So walking into this place at 1 am with my Good friend Georgie after a crazy night on the Castro .. I have discovered one of the BEST slice of Pizza Ive ever Ate!!!  I ordered a CASTRO only in thru Frisco Fashion  and It was EFFIN perfect !  Sprinkled a lil Cheese and a lil Pepper and Bada Bing Bada boom!  It has Pesto Chicken and spinich and Hella cheese !  most defiantly going back REAL SOoOon! payed 9 bux 4 two Slices and 2 drinks Over all Very cheap!
author: La H.

description:
what can i say? im not much of a big pizza eater, but whenever this place is around i must have a slice. i usually get the super combo and get the work of spicys and cheese powder. . . 

perfect place to go for your after the fact drinking time - eating time haha. probabaly wanna get there a little before 1 cause once the after the bar crowd comes.....DAMN IT BE CRACKING!!!! 

the only thing is if they run out of the pizza at that time then they wont make another one, but overall i love this place and can never complain hahah even eat the pizza off the floor if its falls thats how much i love this place haha.!!!
author: Tofer M.

description:
Nizario's is a hole-in-the-wall place with none of the gourmet-y pizza's I like... like potato garlic pesto.  But, I guess pizza is one of those subjective things -- everyone has their favorite types.  

Maybe it doesn't help that pretty much the only times I've been here is at 3am when I'm intoxicated, about to pass out from hunger pangs, and practically crawling in the doors.  Good for those kind of late-night pizza EMERGENCIES, but when you have had one drink too many, it adds insult to injury that this place is small, super bright, and mirrored.  Total house of horrors.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Perfect on a Friday Nights... and Saturday Nights... after drinking mucho and needing a great slice of pizza to ward off a hangover.  

Nizario's is delicious.  I like it because it is not thin crust.  It has got some substantial dough going on.  After trying all of them (I think) The Castro slice is the best!  It didn't seem like something I would like, but now I pay the 2 bucks (?) extra to get this big slice of heaven.  

Now, besides the pizza, the place rocks, really.  They always have loud music on, you may think you are in a club, you may even see people dancing.  There are always great flyers on the wall letting you know what is happening in the Castro.  Finally, I have never had to wait more than 5 seconds for my piece.  Perfecto.

I have thought about trying the other pizza places on Castro, but I just can't pull myself away from Nazario's.
author: Brittney B.

description:
I'm gonna say that I would have given an additional half a star for Nizario's if it were an option.
Can't believe it's taken me this long to really giving them a try, I guess because I've always favored Mozzarella di Buffala for home delivery pizza, but after taking the leap, I may have a new favorite!
Ordered a Nizario's Special (but substituted the Green Pepper for Black Olive) and I swear it seemed like 15 minutes after I hung up my doorbell rang...like, was the guy already outside with my pizza when I phoned?
Seriously though, the delivery was amazingly fast. The pizza was hot and looked great. It definitely hit all the buttons for me, not too much sauce (which yes had a little bit of sweetness to it, but wasn't 'sugary' as was mentioned in an earlier review. GREAT sourdough crust, just the right thickness. Lot's of good coverage with the pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms & olives. (BTW, the sausage is more like the crumbled 'small chunk' variety, versus the bigger hunks.
Great flavor, great fast delivery, great value - all good in my book.
Would I consider it a 'gourmet' pie, like Pizzeria Delfina or Little Star? No, but that's not why you'd order from a place like this. If you want a good tasting, solid, quick, decent, affordable pizza - I highly recommend Nizario's
author: Andrew P.

description:
If you get drunk in Castro on a Fri/Sat night, your inner compass will point you towards Nizario's.

These guys get put through the ringer with people being MESSY so try to be nice to them when you go.  

Good pepporoni pizza...avoid the hawaiian though.  Too many of my friends have gotten the runs from eating it. Not sure why.

Nizarios is also a good place to pull yourself together before going home (either alone or with that special friend you made an hour prior...the insanely bright lights can snap you back to reality).
