author: Diego S.

description:
Simply. The. Best. Better. Than. All. The. Rest.

Friday. Night. 2 am. Ill have the Castro. 

Best Friend and I get a whole pizza. Must wait until home to eat. Start to run up the hill in high heels and short dress. Cab? ugh. no cash. Okay, takin the bus....

Finally.

Pesto. Cheese. Tomato. Garlic. Sauce. Puffy Dough. Deliciousness.
author: Adrienne F.

description: One of the most delicious pizza's at 2:00am after a night of drinking. The only complaint is that the line is long, but its worth it! Whats good for my tummy is good for their business!
author: Josh S.

description:
Hell yes!!! i mean come on... who doesnt go there after bar hopping in the castro... 

pizza is total fresh most of the times i have been there, long lines meaning everyone likes the food right? not 100% on the customer serivce, but come on thats expected at 130am ..... 

newest feature added is the high energy music playing while you grub on some fresh pizza!! LOL! luvs it!
author: Spookee X.

description:
Trusty old Nizarios. It's hard to tell what you really taste like after my taste buds have been numbed senseless by gin, but you sure smell great.

Plus, kudos to any business that'll thrive off of drunk gays.
author: Brian K.

description: Drunken debauchery in Castro makes anyone hungry at 3am. Good thing this place was open. It was delish.
author: Erika A.

description:
Following my friends' usual MO..it seems that after club hopping into the wee hours of the morning, we had to stop off and top our night with a hot slice of Nizario's Pizza.

Every drunk was weaving between us and the counter...which gave us plenty of time to decide our slice choices...actually it gave my booze hound friends more chances to hit on anything standing on 2 legs...be it guy or gal...

I chose the Castro special..which had feta cheese and spinach...you know it's good when I can't even remember if there's meat on it..or maybe I was too drunk to know what I was chewing on...it could have been a dishcloth and still tasted good ...however I got a chance to nibble off my friend's vegetarian slice...OOOOOOhhh..it was good...I love veggie pizza! 

Still 3:00am and the place was stuffed with people, so make sure you know what you want to move the line along. The prices are cheap and the pizza's hot...actually be careful...it'll burn the roof of your mouth on your first bite.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Is a review for a slice of pizza void due to inebriation?

No?

Ok, then this was some damn good pizza! I got the Castro Special and was really excited by the warm, gooey cheese and bits of chicken and pesto. The crust wasn't soggy and it didn't fall apart when I picked it up (which is good because I was pretty foggy and clumsy). 

So, here I am, enjoying my piza at Nizario's and then some big hulking pizza bouncer tells us we need to "take the pizza outside!" What the hell?! It's fucking freezing out! Shivering in the tundra of the Castro, I waited for a cab, fortunate for my warm mass of dough. The taxi cab wouldn't let me bring the pizza in so I really had to scarf it down, but it was well worth it.

Open late and cheap, this is where you ought to wear off some of that alcohol.
author: haley d.

description: AWESOME pizza.  great for late night.  super fast. friendly warning, you'll be surrounded by a bunch of really drunk gays if you go there late night :)  it's in the castro, after all.
author: Arnold Y.

description:
what is delicious when you're stumbling drunk after a night of drinking and in search of something to coat your stomach and slow the absorption of alcohol does NOT translate to delicious, quality pizza when you're ordering for a party of 8. 

i paid $43 for two large pizzas that you could easily count the sparse amount of toppings. i won't be making this mistake again.
author: Torrpedo T.

description: I love Nizario's because they have THE best crust and fresh ingredients. I've tried Marcello's, Escape From New York Pizza, Goathill, Extreme, Orgasmica, Mr. Pizza Man, Pizza Love, North Beach Pizza, Arinell, Cable Car, Cybelle's, Serranos, Pauline's...and some of those are really good but this one is my favorite. It's a family owned business and despite some reviewers opinions, I love these guys. I actually order from them when I'm sober contrary to the club goers in the Castro. I love Nizario's!
author: Lisa D.

description:
Although I do not eat pizza here (cheese and meat)... I was here with a friend, and as he was sprinkling the parmesan on his pizza, he realized it was clogged and tried to take the lid off.  To our surprise, the elderly gentleman who owns the joint came from around the corner, grabbed the cheese out of his hand, yelled at both of us for attemping to take the lid off and told us to leave.  After this treatment he is lucky a report to the BBB was not filed, as this is a sure fire way of losing business premanently.  Shame on you, and your establishment. Learn how to deal with your temper or do not open up shop!  

I would recommend a 'PASS' on this place.

:-("
author: Matt P.

description:
It was ok. 

It is a very bready pizza without much sauce--not really my fav. 

The pizza was also quite late. I was starving by the time it got here, but it still didn't make it a great pizza.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This may sound totally heffer status but BOY do I get tingles down my spine when I think of the Castro Special.

Granted I always seemed to have stumbled my way here with my buddies in my drunken stupor after a night of debauchery around the Castro.. but Seriously, with a capital S.. Castro Special is GREAT.

So great in fact that I bought a whole box as an impromptu birthday cake for my bff, also in my drunken stupor, and she said it was the best birthday cake she's ever had. Sincerely. *Aww*

And hey, I've had it sober alright? Sometimes I've managed to order 2 extra slices for myself for the following day.. OMG, now THAT is heffer status. -__-
author: Av A.

description: Although I am not a pizza eater, my wife loves the infamous Hawaiian pizza (Ham,& Pineapple) & delivered to her close-by office. I don't do pizza at all. My last pizza slice was 1998.
author: Matt G.

description: Enjoy the drunk food! Nizarios is THE place to go for a snack to absorb all that alkie in your body. Bet. 3-4 bucks a slice, you consistently receive hot out of the oven pizza that makes you smile. Maybe other Yelpers visit the wrong part of the day, but at night, my slices were consistently piping hot- the cheese soft and gooey, the bacon and pineapple perfectly blending together in saltiness and sweetness. I will have to open my horizons to the other flavors, but the Hawaiian pizza is my #1. There will be a line, but they take orders efficiently, and you will need to stand and eat your pizza.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Came here after bar hopping. Pizza was good!
Price was fine, and flavor was good.
 
They had a stereo playing some good house music. 

I will definitely return when I go back to SF
author: Thomas M.

description: Nizario's is great, "makes me think back to my college days," pizza.  HOWEVER, as much as Luke A loves Nizario's and as much as I love Luke A to cheesy pieces/slices, I think there's only one hour a day that you should eat your pre-hangover pizza at Nizario's.  Between 1-2:00 am Mon through Thursday after your vodka to air ratio has been inverted and Marcello's is closed.  I like Marcello's better, but Luke A is still the sauciest!
author: P J.

description:
Dear Nizario's,

Why are you so addictingly delicious, so close to my house, and open on my way home from the bar? Did you read my mind? Did you think it was a great idea to serve pizza at all hours of the day and night that it was too high-quality to ever be eaten after a drunken night out? Because I thought so, and you heard my prayers. I love your Castro special, and I hope you never go away because your pizza is just as mouthwateringly satisfying when I'm sober during normal eating hours as it is at night when I need something to put my alcohol to bed.  I think I speak for all of us when I say thanks for existing.
author: Allison G.

description:
it's been years since i've stepped foot in here and was in a rush tonight with a group of friends with nizario's the only place on the way.

total disappointment yet again with bland, overcooked pizza that has been out far too long.

i honestly don't know how this place get's rated any better than 2 stars. marcello's and escape from new york offer far better options, flavor, crust, and overall atmosphere.

plus all their pizza sits in the back on the oven so you can't even get a look for the freshest slice.

if you offered me a carnivorous feast or nizario's cheese pizza - i'd still take the pizza, but i'd still have to pause and think about it a moment.
author: Ennis O.

description:
so this IS related to the Nizario's on Geary.  I always wondered.  They seemed too alike to not be related.

Anyway, yes, good basic choices, cheap, and FAST.  And there are always 3 dudes standing around at the register like the one on Geary, too.

This is basically a Castro version of the Geary NIzario's --- here, you'll find they play house music over the speakers, and they have a TV that plays movies that may possibly have a GLTB theme.  

Just like the other Nizario's, this place has a giant mirrored wall on one side -- so you can drunkenly observe yourself and everyone else chowing down late at night.  Hot mess.  Love it. 

This place could stand to have way more chairs and maybe one or two more tables.
author: Liz C.

description:
Mushroom and spinach; not too hard of an order.

However, there must have been a cup of oregano sprinkled across it. 

I like oregano. Yet, this was like someone dropped the shaker on the pizza and said "oh well, they won't see it past the spinach anyways..."
author: Dixon T.

description:
Wow. For a pizza joint in the heart of the Castro, what makes them think it's okay to make insulting remarks towards gays???

We came in and I was talking with friends and when I proceeded to order, the cashier called back and said something and the others laughed. I laughed back and asked what they said in Farsi and they all stopped and just recomfirmed my order for mushroom pizza. We waited for our food and they called out "mushroom for the girl!" ... I'm not that flamboyant and even if I was a raging nelly queen, it's still not okay to make comments like that. All 5 of us left, with only a bite or two taken from our slices. I didn't touch mine as I was angry and hurt. But it looked gross and low quality. 

Nasty hateful comments towards gays with your store in the heart of the Castro gives this place an F. Don't support hate.
author: Marc D.

description: Fast, friendly, and open late! I'm usually not into pizza, but my friends and I always seem to find our way here after a night out. Hot, always fresh because of the quick customer turnover, and good selection of toppings. The line gets HUGE right at 2am so prepare to wait... It's worth it!
author: Alyssa A.

description: Open late. Castro special is awesome! Try to get here before everyone else does after bar hopping otherwise they will run out of the good stuff.
author: wane a.

description:
You HAVE.  to come to nizarios (preferably wasted) and get castro slice.  
Srsly.
author: Matt N.

description: I went to have a pizza at nazario's on a busy night. A pizza bouncer was filtering the people inside of the place. He was overwhelmed and rude pushing people. The pizza slide was reasonable. Too much cheese and not cooked enough.
author: Vincent S.

description:
In the business world there is a saying:

"Good, Fast, Cheap.  Pick two"

Nizario's is fast and cheap.

I'll let you all figure it out.
author: Thadd L.

description: Ohhhh ,I can not pass by without going in & getting a slice of pizza, delicious ,,,great staff good service.
author: Hope S.

description: They stay open late so i love stumbling in here (literally, sometimes) after a night of drinking with the girls. The pizza is really yummy with a crispy thin crust, and the size is pretty good, too. My favorite is the Hawaiian with crushed red pepper, even after it's heated it is still amazing, or is that the alcohol talking? either way I love coming here for a late night meal.
author: Diana V.

description:
I don't know what it is about you Nazario's...I wish I could quit you. I really wish I could.

Actually, I don't. I love you too much. Always quick and tasty. Love me a Castro Special. And when I feel sassy, I'll add a slice of Greek pizza and have that. And once, when I was REALLY sassy (more like a fat-ass) I added a cheese slice to all that.

Pretty good pizza, always friendly folks. Never had any complaints with this place. :)
author: Nicolas H.

description: I'll never forget the first night I ate at Nizarios when the Mexican wait staff slowly dimmed the lights and put on some sultry music while they watched my girlfriends and I dine on a slice of pizza. Random, right? On the contrary, their pizza is delish. Thick crust, big slices, sooo good. And the best part of it all is that there's take out. Now I can eat yummy pizza and save myself any awkward run-ins.
author: Alex H.

description: great pizza by the slice!   I've lived in SF off and on since 1998.  Mostly in Castro and Haight so I've had my share of pizza by the slice places.  This is one of the best!  Def a fav of mine.  Open late.  Doesn't take long even when the line goes out the door!
author: Erik N.

description: I love Nizario's Pizza Drunk, Sober, I love it! always yummy I've never had anything to complain about, well except for maybe the employees their not exactly "friendly" but then again they're also usually a little to busy to be up and personal with customers. I never really sat down and ate IN Nizario's, but during the day looks like they have a few places to sit and eat, night time always to crowded to tell, but loooove the pizza!
author: Shannon Victoria W.

description: Good, over-loaded pizza, and cool people!
author: LIVE to E.

description: Oddly enough, some of the best pizza I've found is at the hole in the wall known to all drunkards in the Castro! Nice big slices for cheap and served up almost instantly and fresh. Pizza with toppings like pesto, chicken and feta, or salami, pepperoni and mushroom are always top of my list even when not drunk.
author: Alden C.

description:
I can't talk right now, as I burned my mouth on their volcanic cheese today.  This is not a bad thing (just a stupid thing on my part, really).  The ambience is terrible, but that's half the charm.  Today they were playing soccer on the tell (Man City vs Liverpool) and the place is littered with old flyers. 

One thing I miss: The one in the Richmond has these aweful (ly good) home photographed pictures of the pizza.  Like if your blind uncle took photos with his 110 camera, blew them up to poster size and laminted them in grease.  Why aren't more resteraunts this honest with the food promotion?!
author: Ryan G.

description:
Once I was drunk at Tacoria Cancon in the mission, and hopped a cab all the way to Nizarios for a slice.

I have a problem. I am in love with a pizza place. How am I going to break it to my parents?
author: F B.

description:
I think I've been here...really...I mean, there are many fuzzy recollections of me walking through the doors...then leaving feeling totally full and happy.

I think I remember ordering the Castro Pizza...I think it was really good.
author: Matt V.

description: Alright, the pizza is mediocre at best. I have definitely come here several times because my friend lives a couple of doors down and when you've had a few adult beverages, convenience is key. Meh...it's okay.
author: J D.

description:
Pros = Good to eat after a drunken night in the castro, despite long lines you get your food fast, castro special, cheap for slices.

Cons = Bad to eat if you are even remotely sober....in any neighborhood, when you are in a long line you have to wait especially if you are sober after a night of clubbing...you'd much rather be in bed with or without someone. Lastly, and I don't know if being sober is what makes me notice this but.....The guys who serve you seem more rude....is that possible.

Overall I think this is the perfect place to eat when you have consumed mass amounts of liquor....I've even ordered the castro special for a bunch of drunken friends kicking it at my place from the geary location. Liquor + Nizarios Pizza + friends = good times.
author: James J.

description:
Castro Special, try it! Chicken, pesto, bell peppers and onions. As a Castro visitor we wanted to give it a shot and I'm glad we were feeling adventurous last night. I usually don't stray from my favorite ham and pineapple but this was a pleasant surprise.

Perfect way to end a late night of drinking in the neighborhood. Oh and while the loud club music may have irritated some of the guests, this queer didn't mind at all, hayyyy!
author: Tyler J.

description:
Nizario's has been my FAVORITE - NON Pizza Hut place EVER. 

While yes, I cant use my credit card usually, and while yes, they rarely have Pesto pizza when I want it, and while yes, I did get kicked the fuck out while I was drunk on Gay Pride 08 because I was making out with all the boys in there (and girls) - I STILL love this place.

I love greasy pizza, and I even more love the fact that the service is FAST, CONSISTENT, AND the people who work/own this place are SWEET! Sweet as in nice, and forward.

The Pesto is the BEST in the neighborhood, and the pepperoni isnt too bad in its own right. Its open late, and usually a line (while that line moves extremely fast) its all worth it if your coming out of Midnight Sun, The Mix, Badlands, or wanna walk a block from 440 Castro or "The Bar".

Take it from this zoftig San Franciscan - I LOVE PIZZA, and this really is the best.
author: William D.

description: There are a handful of places to grab a slice at the end of the night on the Castro.  This place should be your choice.  The line always goes by super fast and the boys working here are always patient.  I have dropped my can of soda more than once before opening it and they always swap it for a new one.  My clumsyness is always appreciated at Nizario's!
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: I simply CANNOT finish off a night of bar hopping without grub. Good thing about SF is that it's not very difficult to find a place to grab a late night bite, especially if it's a pizza place. This was just as crackin' as the clubs were. So much that I was a bit hesitant to go in at first, seeing that the line was right up to the door. My friend reassured me that the wait wouldn't be long. Yep! I was in and out in under 3 minutes. They handed out the slices to the customers like a well-oiled pizza making machine. I was a bit bummed that they were out of mushroom, so I opted for a pesto slice. It was friggen scrumptious. They aren't shady with the amount that they put on theirs, so I was one happy girl. More please! *burp* =P
author: Rhia R.

description: Ever crave for a pizza slice.  Try the Castro Special.  It's excellent!
author: Ricky M.

description:
Let's be honest, if you going home from the bar three pints and a spliff and your conscious is impaired - go for it. The next morning your stomach will thank you for all the hard work it will have done digesting the thick (cheap) cheese and dough. 

Don't get it twisted, I have probably eaten here more times than the next guy but in all honesty - this is not pizza.

This is Americanized, 2 a.m. slop, and I do I hate to admit I love it, but the city's best deserve 4 n 5 stars. no?
author: Paul R.

description: First off I will preface this with saying the only way to truly enjoy this pizza is when you are bombed and I have only had Nizario's when on booze control. I am afraid to try it when sober because I have a feeling I will realize that it really isn't that good and in fact might suck. So to prevent that from happening I will stick to my stopping by while drinking. So when in the Castro and drinking and you need a slice to help with the hangover looming on the horizon it is highly recommended. The service their is very appropriate for the neighborhood get-in get-out with a hot sticky something in between... the pizza silly
author: Brian S.

description: Have to agree with Panthea on this one.......for taste, Marcellos is better, but when the alcohol is in your system and its after 1 this is the place to go cause its open till 2 AM unlike Marcellos. Decent variety of pizza, but is cash only. It definitely hits the spot when you need something to wake you up for that journey home or to a bed! Plus there are always a ton of cabs right out the door to take you to where ever your final destination may be.......
author: Pierce B.

description: I like the fact that it's open really late on any given night. The only pizza I would recommend here is the "Castro" pizza. If you want anything else, I'd recommend another pizzeria somewhere else.
author: Jose R.

description:
Awesome pizza! Cheap reasonable and absolutely delicious! 
Damn good when you're drunk.. yum!
Just go try it.
author: Kongie V.

description: Great to eat after hours , fast service..good staff too. No bathroom as far as I know about it.
author: B H.

description: Having lived in this neighborhood, I firmly believe that Nizario's is the worst of the three pizza-by-the-slice places all within a block of 18th and Castro. My main recollection is that their dough is incredibly boring: 'meh'. Marcello's and Escape from NY are much better, and both great at that.
author: Jon U.

description:
I am originally from NJ, so I know my pizza.

This pizza is one stop above frozen pizza, it sucks. And if you are in a wheelchair, you can't use this establishment.
author: Matt W.

description: That it caters to drunks and the party-hard set late at night is hardly a glowing recommendation. That the pizza - with a nice, zesty sauce, ample cheese, and fresh toppings - is excellent is what draws me back, thankfully in the light of the day when the crowd is sober and apparently better behaved than the masses at midnight. Friendly service, good prices, and far better than Marcello's or Escape from New York.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Best pizza slice option in the area.  Probably top 5 pizza slice places in the city overall.  Never a fail, always solid.  They deliver too.
author: Big Toe ..

description: another pzza in castro. well my hawaain pizza and pesto it was even better flavor or taste. just  $ 3.00 dlls. i was eating my pizza with my friends when i was watching Tv. I was in shock to heard Whitney Houston just die. Drugs I dont know. but  the its awesome  to meet people and mingle. this place its cheap. cheap. greaaaat.
author: Cesar E.

description: Castro special and a soda after bar hopping will help with sobering one up to drive back home. Savory and cheesey, the slice of pizza was delish!!! My only regret was that I ate the pizza too quickly in my drunk stupor. Oh, and that they don't take cards after hours, and my friend wounldn't stop bitching about it afterwards...
author: Liz A.

description: i'm drunk...and just had their combo slice.  FIVE stars.  greasy, salty, tasty, cheesy, and perfection.  I'm drunk.
author: Adrian N.

description: My stomach is growling just thinking about this place!! You gotta try the CASTRO SPECIAL!! Its a small little pizza joint not the cleanest place...but decent enough..the pizza is well worth it! Good place to go to after a night of dancing and drinkin!!
author: Wendy T.

description: My search for good pizza in San Francisco continued at Nizario's, but alas has not ended at Nizario's.  Far and above Marcello's with a passable pizza crust and good topping combinations.  However they load up on the cheese, skimp on flavor in the sauce and just seem to be missing something else.  If memory serves, they also have a TV and that's a definite "No No" in my pizza prize criteria.
author: Bryna M.

description:
Suffice it to say, the majority of my experience with this place has been when I'm completely hammered off my ass. And every time I come, I have to wade through the sea other other drunkards only to stumble up to the counter and have the dilemma of my life in choosing what type of pizza I want. What I think is great about this place is that no matter what, they will always heat your pizza for you. This is in stark contrast to Pizza Orgasmica, where you have wait in an endless line in a super hot entry way only to be served a thin, cold slice of pizza where the cheese oils have created a congealed layer of disgustingness. (Side note I don't understand why every one raves about that place; the pizza is pretty crappy, particularly if you've had to endure the throngs of drunk, obnoxious Marina-ites in their infinite line). Nizario's is fast, their dough is good (doughy in the middle, slightly crisp on the bottom) and their prices are quite average, which is fine. 

Now, I thought that this was simply a drunken revelation; warm, gooey pizza is always delicious when wasted. However, last night, I was shown that this place is pretty damn good sober. Maybe it was because I was starving and had had a really shitty day, but nevertheless, it was yum. And, for the first time in my experience, it was empty. I guess all the drunks were waiting until later to invade(although, it was already near 10). Try the Castro special: spinach, feta, chicken, and pesto. mmmmm. Or the super combo, which basically has everything on it. I'm not saying this is the best pizza in the world, but it hits the spot when you need it. Major plus: the people working there are super friendly, even when you're near belligerent.
author: Veronica W.

description:
Rudest people I've ever seen.  I went in and told the guy at the register what I wanted.  He blurted it back to the guy at the oven and rang up the total without telling me, just pointed.  Never made eye contact and looked pretty much bothered to even be there.   When I paid he counted, handed me back my 50 cents and yelled "NEXT!"  It was only me and only one other person standing behind me.  Never said anything to me or made any attempt to show he appreciated my business.

The pizza was the worst.   Reheated yet still not fully cooked.  Raw and gooey dough just under the sauce and slightly bitter overall.  I might have overlooked the nasty pizza as a fluke but combined with the attitude, it told me that these people don't really care about customers or their product.

Avoid this place like the plague.  Go to Escape from New York.  It's reheated there too but at least the people appreciate their customers.
author: Jon D.

description: After an evening of bar hopping and "being gay" as my friend put it, we needed a late night munchy break, and what better late night eats cuisine than pizza! So off we headed to Nizario's. The biggest impression I received from this place was whatever slice I ordered that evening was out to chase the vampires. Garlic, you want garlic? Omg, soo much graciously good garlic on my slice--was it the Greco? I failed at that part, failed to write this review soon enough. Oh, and they're pretty quick here too. And yes, for more garlic, I shall return!
author: Ryan T.

description: I was stumbling around with my two friends, enduring a MAJOR case of the drunchies, and happened upon this. No need to get crappy Denny's or anything of the sort. Long line, yes, but it went very fast. The pizza slice was so good that I had a second one, then proceeded to inhale it while hanging around outside and talking to other drunks. I'll have to come back when I'm sober... or will I? To be continued.
author: Courtney S.

description: I went there sober the other night for the first time and the pizza was STILL wonderful.  Also, the guy who works at the register said "it's nice to see you again" which i guess makes me a regular, and I'm totally into being a regular at a hole-in-the-wall pizza place.  However, one night last week some friends and I ordered a pizza for delivery and there was way too much sauce for my taste.
author: Caleb D.

description: I do like Nizario's Pizza and i love the fact that its open really late. If i had to pick between Nizario's or Marchello's I would pick Marchello's. Don't get me wrong but this place is great and what not but they don't have the premade slices of pizza i want. I do enjoy their pepperoni pizza and veggie pizza, their quick and friendly. You will def find me here when i wanna switch it up from my regular pizza joint!
author: Lucky M.

description: Delicious, open really late, kind of greasy but just the right amount, cheap and always an interesting crowd to watch -- what is not to like? afterhours pizza was made for Nizario's.
author: Roman R.

description: i just recently went there..and I think they have new owners and/or changed the pizza...THEY SUCK!!!  They do no taste the same as they use to!  I'M PISSED!! Also want to add the service is not as friendly as the other owners!
author: Dimplez D.

description: After a few drinks this place is perfect!  Awesome hot pizza and very reasonable.  Try the Castro Special Pesto pizza. It's Awesome!
author: mitch a.

description: Because I try not to eat solid foods on weekends, I only ever end up eating the pizza here when I'm drunk.  I do enjoy the Castro Special!  The Castro IS special!  Special!  Special!  YAY!!!
author: Marcus C.

description: When you are going bar hopping and stop in to get a slice, the pizza is pretty darn good.  When you order a pie over the phone for delivery, it doesn't taste the same.  ie:  Way Way Way too much cheese and not enough sauce.  Our bellies hurt after eating a couple of pieces it was so cheesy.  But again, the walk-in-grab-a-slice is pretty good.  2.5 stars
author: Jason I.

description: Shaking your butt all over the castro works up a girl's appetite.  And thankfully Nizario's makes a great after bar slice.  The kind of slice that after you have one you still want another.  The pizza is like a drug.  And then you get to feel guilty for the next two days, but it is worth it.
author: Alexis M.

description: I'm gonna be honest when I say that I've only ever been here when extremely drunk, but who cares? Each and every time was memorable, and their Greko pizza is love, I can keep eating and eating... I've been meaning to go when sober, but then it may lose it's appeal.
author: Danielle D.

description: Solid pizza. Got pepperoni straight out of the oven. It was plasma hot so I had to wait a bit for it to cool off. Good pepperoni, tasty cheese, decent sauce, and great crust. Price is a bit more expensive than Serrano's (takes 2 slices to equal their single,) but it's a completely different style and variety is nice and all. I'd seen the place long ago, but just not got around to trying it. Shouldn't of waited. I'll be going back.
author: Ross M.

description:
great pizza - great selection and price. delivers so that's a plus cause when you want pizza you are usually too lazy to go get it. open late which is a huge plus.

also, the last time we went inside they had 40yr old virgin playing on the tv - good stuff.
author: michella s.

description: I'm seriously surprised! I was complaining that we weren't getting at Marcello's and then I had a bite. I wasn't drunk...so it wasn't just beer munchies. This pizza is GOOD. Not NY style, but still delicious. Lot's of people said Castro special is good. I'm a no-nonsense kind of person and prefer cheese...
author: Anita C.

description: Best Late Night Pizza Ever!!!! I heart their Castro Special.  It's their signature with pesto, feta, spinach, and chicken.  It is delicious.  I've tried their other toppings, but the castro special is truly something unique.
author: Maybelline C.

description: There's a lot of fancy pizza places in this neighborhood, but sometimes you just want a slice of cheese before seeing a movie, y'know?  The pizza here always seems fresh, and the service is quick.  $3 for a cheese slice still seems like way too much to me, but I understand that this is the going rate these days.  Not the best pizza slice in town, but useful in a pinch.
author: Gordon E.

description:
pizza before beer, come here!
i know, i'm backwards, but in anticipation for a night of heavy drinking, i like to coat my stomach with yummy melty greasy cheese from here.  it's the perfect gaysian pregame for a night in the castro!
author: Monk R.

description: Mmm Are you drunk? Do you need Pizza? Try Not to J-Walk to get it ~ The pizza is good, and you get it fast so its great for those impatient people who need something other than alcohol in their bellies.
author: jen t.

description: Best. Pizza. Ever. ... or at least my favourite. Always the place to go after all the bars close. The night is over once you have a slice of the The Castro Special... a night without it gives you the hangover, not the alcohol. You might have to dance a couple of hours beforehand to prepare for the calories, but who cares... it's like coke for your mouth... but it's not something you need rehab for (cuz I said: "no, no, no").
author: Shane W.

description:
nizario's vs. marcello's.

the never ending battle of "best pizza place in castro." (i'm not even acknowledging escape from new york. sorry guys.)

while this debate may never be settled, i personally have always preferred nizzy's. they just have better crust, toppings and marinara sauce. period period. and nothing in the area compares to nizzy's castro special.

now, if only i still allowed myself to eat carbs...
author: Maveric V.

description: Their pizza's decent, though their pepperoni slices have frequently had disappointing amounts of pepperoni on them. Sometimes I make them give me a better slice; tonight I just told them the slice was wanting. The guy didn't seem responsive to my feedback. At least they're open late.
author: Jim W.

description: Next to Cheese Board Pizza in Berkeley, Nizario's houses my favorite SF pizza.... The Castro Special = Chicken Pesto Cheese (i think it also has spinach). Sober or not, this pizza is to die for (unless youre a vegan or something, then ok).  Everyone I have steered over to this place has become addicted to the Castro Special... I'm hungry now.
author: Shayenne G.

description: Update '09: Man has this place gone down hill. The pizza is decent enough, though not as good as it used to be. But now it feels like a night club. REAL loud music, nothing but kids hanging out and acting out, super bright lights, none of the artwork, photography and community event lisitings on the walls any more. definitely not worth the hassle to go there anymore
author: Eric P.

description: After a night's drinking there is really only one thing on anyone's mind and that is a good old greasy slice of pizza. This is _the_ hole in the wall place everyone comes to after a night out in the Castro. and frankly the eclectic mix here is way more fun than the late night hordes of drunken frat-kids at Orgasmica. Still not sure if the pizza really is that good or it just tastes that way at that time of night, but the pesto is quite excellent. The staff is friendly despite having to put up with a lot of shenanigans, and service is prompt.
author: Stuart J.

description: stay away! went here and got food poisoning from the pepperoni. Boo. Cheap ingredients. And no, it wasn't the alcohol!
author: Brad D.

description: I have to say, the pizza is good. What overshadows the quality, however, is the service. I noticed a discrepancy in their pricing, and what started out as a simple question turned into a huge argument. The entire crew started attacking me simply because I pointed out that the price listed on their menu didn't add up to what they were actually charging me. When the phone rang, both employees ran to answer it to avoid answering my question. I'm still shocked at what I saw- what should have been a simple explanation did not need to get so out of hand. The guy ended up yelling at me that he didn't need my gratuity (after saying math is hard). Sorry guys- pizza isn't that difficult; I'll take my business to someone that is honest and doesn't attack me when I ask a simple question.
author: Michael T.

description: Yes, the pizza is great at 2am, in fact, it's great at 2pm too (and I am USUALLY sober at 2pm). I don't usually recall being there, but I always remember how good the pizza is. Two words of advice, first, get there before 1:45 or you have to wait when the bars close. Second, ask to use the bathroom...when you're wasted, it's a trip to walk through the kitchen and up these little stairs (at least it seemed strange to me, but I was drunk..)
author: Jason D.

description: This pizza place got me through many nights of studying while I was in college. The one on 19th avenue was the one I used to get it from, but I hear this one has the ?grecko? too!. By far one of  the best pizza joints!
author: Erin O.

description: Many fond memories at Nizario's.  The crust is perfect...crispy and soft and very tasty.  My fav is the mushroom pizza with extra cheese, sauce and mushroom loaded with crushed pepper and garlic powder.
author: Marie E.

description: I went here on a rainy day, and this place made it all cozy. Anyway, the pizza here tastes surprisingly "gourmet," even though it's kind of a chain. I had fun watching "Rosie's Family Cruise" while waiting for my pizza to arrive.
author: Alex Y.

description: i have to say this is some good ass pizza by the slice...love the GREKO but it make's your breath hummen and crackn there aint no gum or mouth wash that will help you to get laid that night lol
author: David C.

description: i'm yelpin` here because i'm feenin` for some nizario's pizza. it's been on my mind all day. their crust is the best. it's crunchy but not too hard like cardboard. i also like the fact that they actually put enough sauce for the pizza, so that i'm not only eating cheese bread.
author: Marisol T.

description: i came here on a whim one hungry night and was expecting much better pizza considering the rave reviews people have given me.  i had two slices of the Castro and must say that it was decent (albeit a little on the cold side), but i've certainly had better and prefer marcellos or escape from ny pizza over nizarios any day.
author: Ben T.

description: Nizarios, I thank you for having mastered the "cheese to dough" ratio. You pizza is cheesy but not greasy, doughy but not too "crusty." I love you Nizarios, day or late late night. (They are open until 3 AM, I believe, and their line goes surprisingly fast.)
author: Saleema F.

description: This is one of my favorite pizza places in San Francisco, which is saying nothing since the pizza is so bad in this town.  My girlfriend says that it reminds her of the pizza you got in middle school.  I kind of like it though.
author: Napoleon R.

description: Nizario's is a great place to have single sliced pizza. It beats greasy Blondies any day. It's cheap and fast when you're looking food after a drunken night out in The Castro. If you're looking for "California" style pizza with everything under the sun on it... then this place isn't for you. If you're looking for simple classic style pizza (ie. cheese, pep, combo, mushroom, pesto) then you've got a winner. Thanks for reading, Silvia.
author: Silvia S.

description: Is it sad that I have them programmed into my phone? At least they're not on my speed dial anymore, right? The only drawback to this place is that a line can form down the block when there's an event in the castro.
author: Allison B.

description: This place use to get 4 stars because it use to be open till 3 on weekends and 2 on weekdays, hence between 2-3 am on weekends it would  turn into club nizarios, and id always stumble home at the end of the night with a good story.  I haven't been back as much since they changed times, but they serve up a decent slice of pizza (ive been spoiled by NYC visits sadly). If you're in the neighborhood and craving pizza, this is the place to go....try the cheese/castro special.
author: Geetika A.

description:
The nice folks taking phone orders and making deliveries use phrases not often heard in the city, such as "I'm sorry" (used when appropriate, which is only occasionally) and "thank you" (used almost always).  

As a displaced Midwesterner, I give them five stars for this reason alone.  Three cheers for common courtesy!  Plus the pizza is fairly tasty.
author: Steve R.

description: I am very annoyed at his place. I love the pizza but am unable to get them to deliver to me. ( I am only 1.64 miles  or 8 minutes away according to yahoo maps) First the guy who was taking my order, after taking my address explains that the driver isn't in right at that moment.  I explained that I wasn't in a particular hurry and was told they wouldn't deliver to my area, that it was too far. i would figure being within a 2 mile radius would be suitable but, whatever. It was obviously clear that they didn't want to go to my street for whatever reason and the attempted to lie to me. I am really bummed because i really enjoy this pizza but won't be ordering from here again.
author: pascale p.

description: I would have rated Nizario's higher but the quality has declined. I used to love the "San Francisco" but over time i'm getting less cheese, spongy  half cooked dough and the slices are as limp as banana peels. ALSO - PRICES ON THE WEBSITE ARE DEAD WRONG. It's pretty shady when they refuse to spend a nickel to update the website. The small reads $12.90 but you will be charged $13.90 upon delivery. I questioned the discrepancy and the main guy confirmed the website has yet to be updated. On a more positive note - they are by far the fastest to delivery in the Mission/Castro area. It takes 15-30 minutes on average. I will gladly order from them again but they need to bring back quality and update the website.
author: Shady B.

description: Best pizza in SF after a long night partying!  I highly recommend it...it has dance music which makes it sound like a club from the outside lol
author: Rob P.

description: A little bit breadier than i usually like, but thats about my only complaint. I use normal pepperoni as my yard stick for pizza places and this one is right on target. Always perfectly sauced, the sauce isn't too sweet either. But other than that the castro special is what you come here for. Creative flavors perfectly executed...yes it is possible to make better pizza but it would be like trying to tell the difference between a 60 dollar and 300 dollar bottle of wine, 99% of the world just cant do it.
author: Gavin M.

description: Nizario's is one of the best pizza places in SF.  The Castro Special is delicious! I love that its open late. Its a nice little spot, especially after a night at the BAR.
author: crystal e.

description: I've had most of the flavors here and like their crust and sauce(es).  The Castro special, with spinach, chicken, and pesto sauce is the best in Eureka Valley. Friendly staff, grungy place, sometimes customers are wacked out (latenite).  Update:  they've freshened up the place -- far less grungy now...
author: Castro G.

description: I wont repeat what everyone else has said about this place as I concur, but this place is also good delivery!  For those who like one slice, imagine a couple large ones for a party.  SO goood!  Sometimes I wish I were sober when I eat there because then my taste buds would actually work!  Castro special all the way.
author: Dylan D.

description:
my favorite pizza place in san francisco.
nothing beats nizarios!
maybe its because it is open so late, after drinking all night,
or maybe its because the price, and quality is there.
best pizza ever.
author: Ryan B.

description: The pizza is fine but ordering over the phone is a nightmare.  The guy taking the call was clueless.  I had to repeat everything a few times and after he finally got it right, there was a "computer error" and we had to do the entire thing all over again.  Oh yeah, the greek salad pretty much sucked.
author: Rich C.

description: Nothing like a good slice of Nizario's pizza.  They do a great job of delivering pizzas too.  I've ordered many pizzas for our Monday Night Football poker parties and they always deliver quickly.
author: Cooper's Uncle ..

description: I'm not much of a pizza connoisseur, but here goes... The crust was awesome (I am a carb addict) and there wasn't a crazy load of cheese on it to weigh it down. Delivery is fast!
author: GS M.

description: I've heard wonderous things about this place, but I've tried calling in a delivery order a couple of times now. The first time, after like and hour and a half, they finally called to re-confirm my address. When I told them (again), they said, oh we don't deliver there, and hung up. I'm in the Castro, not on the moon! So I tried to give them another chance today... well, they are open, but their phone rang again and again, but nobody every picked up. I think I'm done trying with these folks.
author: Ken W.

description:
I LOVE THIS PIZZA! 

I come and eat here everytime I am in the Castro!
Cheap great tasting pizza slices and always hot! 
Love it! 

You need to come to North Beach and open up shop!
author: mel g.

description: Nizario's is one of my favorite pizza parlors in the city.  I find them to be very consistent.  The pizza is always hot n delicious.  I usually order by phone for delivery. . .it's always quick and easy, and the delivery people couldn't be nicer.  And it doesn't hurt my wallet either.  Very reasonably priced.
author: Gregory W.

description: You go here because it's the only pizza place open late - if they were smart they would be open til 3am every night and draw in night crawlers from SOMA and other after-hours areas of the city
author: Quartknee K.

description: These clowns need a geography lesson.  Apparently they don't deliver to the Duboce Park area which is no more than 15 minutes walk away from their store.  They told us to order from the Geary store which is 2.5 miles away.  When we called Geary, they quickly sent us back to this store.  When we spoke to the same guy again he said "uh - i just got here".
author: Dave F.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Nothing tops off a night of drunken mayhem like stumbling in here and getting some fucking PIZZZZAAAAAA!!!!!!! It's relatively cheap and awesome, plus the staff is incredibly nice. I'm surprised they're not insane from having to deal with all us drunks. If I could give this place 6 stars, I would.
author: Michael G.

description: i never remember going here, i never remember leaving, but i'll never forget the pizza.... this is a great place to end up when drunk, and b/c somehow someone once remembered to order enough for leftovers, i've found that's a good enough to love when you wake the next morning with a whopping hangover!
author: Roshni R.

description: i don't care for the crust too much, but the combo pizza was pretty good with big portions.
author: Jen P.

description: Nothing better than Nizario's after a late night ... Castro Special or Pepperoni are my favorites. The service is incredibly quick & the prices are fair. *AND* they deliver to our home! And as 'Alden C' noted, I love it even when I am not drunk!
author: Devin P.

description: sooo this is our usual pit stop after a night of dancing/drinking at the cafe, buuuuut unlike most pit stops, this place is actual GOOD when ur sober!!  but i recommend buying only whole pies, so that u don't get stuck w/one of those pieces that could have been sitting around for a while...
author: Tammy Y.

description: It's a pretty much mandatory late night stop after an evening out in the Castro. Their pizza is wonderful, and the line is long but moves quickly!
author: Michael H.

description: best pizza in the castro, by far!  maybe best in the city after goat hill.
author: eric i.
